reviewTitle: Great Projector, Disappointed with Phone Streaming
reviewDescription: This projector has a great picture and seems well-made overall. However, we've been disappointed that we can't stream anything directly from our phones due to copyright restrictions.While we were able to work around it by connecting a laptop via HDMI, the convenience of phone mirroring was a big selling point for us. It's frustrating to be limited to using a separate bulky device for streaming services.If you prioritize phone mirroring for streaming content, this projector might not be the best choice. Otherwise, it's a solid option with a great picture quality.

The power cable end that goes into the projector is too loose and keeps falling, requiring me to keep turning it back on restarting over and over again.  Geez how hard is it to provide a cable that actually works, i.e. stays attached!!!!  I want to use this projector to project images onto my canvases so that I can trace the images on them. Takes a lot of time just to get a sketch done because the stupid plug in if the cable keeps falling out or getting loose. Either way I keep having to restart the darn Projector.It projects images just fine but this cord plug should NOT be such an issue.UPDATE: The seller contacted me only to blame and demean me for the problem by saying that I didn’t push the plug in hard enough. DUH!  That is the first thing that anyone with average intelligence would do and exactly what I did—repeatedly !  They didn’t even offer to send me a replacement power cord.  What a huge lack of accountability on their part!

(update  they are sending projector number 3 customer support reached out after posting review and asked what was going on and asked for pictures they Believe there wasn't adequate ventilation so got to figure out where to put it if not on a shelf above the bed because that's too close to wall with about  7 inches of space behind it .) First projector lasted casual use for 3 months before discoloration spot got really dark and largeThe 2nd projector discolored in 2 weeksCustomer support thought it might be overheating and said there should be a prompt never got one and I had a thermometer 10 inches away never reached over 70°f  around it with exhaust from it blowing on thermometer. I have it in the open on a shelf with nothing directly around it and we'll product just doesn't last casual usage burns out in same spot only reason it's on the right this time and not the left is because this time I flipped the projector up side down for even better ventilation.

reviewTitle: Every room dont need a TV/Above avarage quality.
reviewDescription: My previous projector purchase had better viewing quality, but not sound. This one is the opposite. Viewing not bad! Bluetooth capable, but just not as crisp as the previous returned purchase. Great budget

The color is good, just a little dimmer. The noise is great for small rooms, if you're planning on using this in huge areas or outside it's most likely not a good purchase. It doesn't work with Chrome books but it does with Macbook's.

reviewTitle: Get the warranty, just in case
reviewDescription: It works great. My roommate and I bought 3 and only 1 had a problem. There is a burn spot on the lens and unfortunately, I can’t really see the left side. That being said get the warranty, just in case. The volume works just fine but you might want to hook up a speaker for larger rooms or bigger gatherings.

reviewTitle: Read if you need an additional port to connect
reviewDescription: So far I r turned it on looks good BUT I didn’t know I need a port to connect my IPhone I originally purchased this for a party I’m hoping now the port gets here on time. Will come back to update the review

reviewTitle: Worked well but didn't last long
reviewDescription: I had it just over a month when I started seeing a large dark spot just underneath the center and off to the side a bit. Bums me out because I liked it a bunch till it started deteriorating.
When it works it works…when it doesn’t it doesn’t.🙃😕

reviewTitle: It is not bright enough to give a work presentation.
reviewDescription: Even with the lights off it is not bright enough to present with. I even closed the drapes on the window and people couldn't see the presentation well enough to read. It makes noise but fair for the price point.

What a piece of junk.I bought this two months ago as a Christmas gift, and have only given it to the my sister last week. Let me tell ya, it’s one inconvenience after another.Here’s the list in chronological order.1.) Opened it up, thinking it was bluetooth or had the required cables to connect to an iPhone. Turns out it didn’t and this one is my fault. I should have looked at the reviews. It will only come with an hdmi connector (both ends), and you’ll need a lightning-hdmi adapter if you want to use a wired connection with your phone. It’ll work if you’re only using it for a laptop. If you want to use Bluetooth, you need to buy a dongle that allows connection and attach it to the project. While there’s a USB port, you can’t use your typical charger to directly connect your phone into the projector.2.) Bought an hdmi-lightning adapter, and it was easy to connect it at first where it’ll ask you to trust the device on your phone like the prompt that you get when you connect your phone to your computer. I don’t know why it requires that, but moving on. Once you accidentally turn off screen mirroring, good luck connect it to the stupid thing again. You’ll either have to reset your iPhone settings, or have to turn your iPhone off and on in order to reconnect. And you will have to do that a lot because it’ll kick you off whenever it decides to. You’d think you’d see it under the screen mirroring options, but nope. It’s not there at all.3.) Once I got the hang of it, 10 minutes into continuously using it, it made a loud high pitched noise, and the image froze while distorted. No matter how many times I turned both the iPhone and projector on and off, it started doing it one minute into watching a video. I figured it was the adapter I bought. Because you need to power the hdmi adapter with a lightning charger, I thought it wasn’t getting enough power since I used the old iPhone charger that only delivers 5W. Switched it out with a 20W charger and power brick, but nope, still the same result. Then I used my other brick that delivered 65W. This time, the projector lasted a bit longer before doing the same thing as it did before.I give up.Piece of crap.It’s, overall, stupidly useless. You can’t use it. At least the one I got can’t be used. It’s cheap at $90, but you’d expect it function at least. What a piece of junk. I would have returned it if the return window hadn’t closed.Saved you some frustrations. Find a different projector.

reviewTitle: Grainy picture lacking focus with okay sounding speakers
reviewDescription: I bought this projector for two use cases. 1 - to use outdoors for family movie nights.  2 - to save my primary Epson projector bulb from being wasted on my son's 578th viewing of ABC kids songs. Let's just say after getting the projector my expectations were not met.Setup was fairly simple, just provide power and an HDMI source. I used an old Fire TV Stick as a source to stream some YouTube and Amazon Originals as a test. The projector was roughly 12 feet from an existing white screen. I had to make the room pitch black to be able to see an image. The picture was very grainy with white shimmering throughout. The projector has a manual knob to adjust focus and I found either the edges of the image or the center could be in focus - never both. This was most noticeable when using subtitles. There were also several instances where it looked like the image was lagging and would skip some frames.The built in speakers started off shrill. But over the hour long viewing session either they broke in, or we got used to them. The speakers do a great job of drowning out the cooling fan. There is some heat coming off the side of the unit, but it isn't too bad.The remote control is fine function wise. I was able to control the unit from anywhere in the room without any problems.Overall, if you have a child that isn't picky about image quality in a pitch black room, this is the projector for you. For outdoor family viewing nights, I will keep looking for a better solution.UPDATE: After using the projector for a few hours it began to let out a strong plastic smell that filled the room and caused my head to hurt. Amazon replaced the projector and the new one does not do the same.

I have bought every little extra piece that goes to this projector to connect it to my iPhone and after multiple tries, it still will not let us stream our movies. I’m not out of time to send it back after waiting for all the pieces to come in since they don’t just you know, come with the projector to begin with. It’s probably just a faulty product but what a waste of my time and super frustrating considering I’ve gotten the kids excited about it multiple times.

So, we're in the process of moving. Figured I'd give this a go to try and hold us over while all our items are packed up (including TVs) by the moving company.HOWEVERThe picture quality is terrible, the focuser only focuses the inner like 50% of the screen. It has no angle adjustment so you have to prop it up on a book or something.The connectivity on it is GARBAGE. The only way to use this would be with some sort of laptop. Don't bother trying with a phone, many phones do not include HDMI over USB, and even if it does many of the apps like Netflix, Hulu, Pluto don't work right. I guess it might work if you had a fireTV or Roku to plug into itBUT ALSO:The picture quality is terrible. Its definitely 720p, there's no way this is 1080p, its most likely labeled 1080p because it takes a 1080p signal and converts it to 720p which is the DUMBEST thing ever.It has NO BRIGHTNESS. even in a 5pm afternoon shadow with the blinds down it is completely unusable. In pitch black darkness it is still not acceptable. I don't know if the people using this only watch at midnight in a black painted room or what, but the whole point of this thing is to be able to take it anywhere, set it up and use it to watch things.Its a complete failure. I don't know how this many people left 5 star reviews, its DOG CRAP do not buy. I'm going to go buy a 150$ 43" TV from Walmart instead.

reviewTitle: Absolute trash don’t believe these reviews
reviewDescription: This is my first time leaving a review. Very cheaply made product, so light weight it will tip over if you have a window open in your house. It will tip because if you breathe too hard it will fall off of the makeshift stand you had to make out of books and pillows to actually view the screen on a wall.  It’s not adjustable at all in any direction so you have to put it on a stand at the exact height you want to project to. If you want to view it on the ceiling you have to stand it up vertically and exactly underneath the center of the ceiling so it will be on your bed. I could go on for days about the positioning of this trash.The picture is absolutely terrible no matter what and the volume is just as bad if not worse. Your phone on speaker mode is about twice as loud as this abomination. I had it for a few months until it just stopped working, I used it about a dozen times. Please don’t waste your money, it also doesn’t come with anything you’ll need to connect it to your phone

I immediately noticed that when focusing the projection for the first time, it was impossible to focus the entire image. If the middle was focused, the lower quadrant was out of focus. If the lower quadrant was in focus, the rest of the image was not. There was no fixing this, no matter how I angled the projector, adjusted the keystone, settings, etc.On top of that, the resolution is horrible. I put on an episode of Futurama for the trial run of this projector. It looks great on my laptop screen, but the image projected reminded me of an old video game. Again, no settings were able to improve on this.The color and brightness also left a lot to be desired. I tried different settings, and nothing I tried could improve the abysmal performance of this projector.The color wheel and lamp went out on my first projector, so I thought I would replace it rather than repair it since this option was cheaper. I am returning this projector and will instead repair my old one.Auking makes a usable projector that lists for $159.99. It's still slightly unfocused around the edges, but for the money, it's not bad. It needs to be used as perpendicular to the wall/ceiling as possible to minimize that effect, and not use the keystone adjustment.

This is my second time replacing this projector and I believe that the brand is defective. The first time I purchased this, a large orange looking spot appeared on the screen within the first month of purchase. After following instructions on removing dust with the included swab, there were was no success. It did not look like dust particles but more like a burn into the lens. I used the warranty and had it replaced. Now I’m on the second projector and as you can see from the included photos you can decipher what is dust particles at the top of the left corner of the screen and the “burn like mark” that I have circled. I am able to remove those particles but the mark that is circled in the photo will not go away. I’m out of the warranty period this time so I will look else where for a projector.

This is the second projector I have bought that had become unusable. The cleaning swabs do nothing. I’ve taken it apart and you can’t actually clean the device the make it so you’re unable to disassemble to repair without breaking the whole box. The first one lasted about a year this one has lasted two months

HDMI Cabled to Laptop or iPhone is a FAILURE.  Constant cut in/cut out of picture.  Constant sound crackling and cut in/cut out.  Crap product.  I'm going to Best Buy to purchase a name brand product.

Projector worked well for about 6 months then the bulb started to turn yellow and gradually got darker. Some shows I can’t see in that area at all. Seller support website is down. No help from the seller

reviewTitle: Gets the job done, worth it for the price
reviewDescription: I first got this product a couple of years ago when it was pricier (a little over $100 I believe). As someone who only watches tv in the evenings, this projector is perfect for me! I have it mounted above my bed and project it onto a bare wall. I think the picture quality is quite good for the price, it's never bothered me, though I'm sure there are some with higher quality image. My one complaint is the volume--the projector itself makes a pretty loud sound when running, and I've noticed on some platforms that the volume isn't super loud. It's perfectly loud enough for my bedroom, however. I just think if you were using it outside, the volume might not be amazing. However I think you can connect a speaker to it somehow, I just haven't tried. Overall, I've liked it so much that I've convinced my boyfriend and sister to get the same one. My boyfriend even has an apple TV connected to his, which really helps make use of the machine very simple. I would recommend it as a nice alternative to a tv, especially if you watch the most television at night when it is dark!

reviewTitle: Great customer service, great audio, but inconsistent and difficult to clean.
reviewDescription: VERY DETAILED REVIEW.I have had this projector for well over a year now and have used it almost every single day, sometimes 16 hours a day for background noise or for entertainment for my cats. There are some great positives to this projector and company, as well as negatives. After a couple of months of having this projector, I started to notice DUST build-up that was projecting onto my screen. This absolutely drove me crazy, and I tried everything to clean it. I probably went through half a dozen cans of compressed air and shoved the nozzle into EVERY crevice I could find, but still nothing. The dust would not budge. The build-up got so bad after 6-7 months that I even tried to take it completely apart to clean it and it did nothing. I ended up emailing the company showing and explaining the dust build-up, and they were so very understanding and told me not to think twice about it, and they sent me a new one free of charge. I never asked or even alluded to wanting another projector, only a solution or way of cleaning it. Of course, I was very thankful and excited to have the original quality I started out with. The CUSTOMER SERVICE was incredible. They were very friendly, kind, and quick to respond.I USED this projector in every capacity at least a few times. I had it connected to my laptop and even played Xbox through my projector. Most of the time I had an HDMI port plugged in that provided multiple outlets so I could do different things. I used a Roku on my projector to watch TV. The CONTROLS were not the easiest to figure out and required research to connect to a Roku. I had to use the projector remote for the volume and power and then used the Roku remote to change the channels and such. There was no way of merging the two since this projector is not identified on Roku's list of compatible projectors (there were probably hundreds on there total.)I initially bought this for the bedroom so I could save the room a TV would take up without sacrificing the size of the screen. It also gave my cats endless entertainment without having to worry about a scratched-up TV screen. The first month I had it, I LOVED it. I placed it on a mounted shelf above my bed, and the SOUND quality was amazing. It sounded like a good quality TV does, except above your head and therefore creating a more realistic feel when watching intense movies or shows. I have no complaints about the sound quality of the first projector I received. However, after receiving the second projector, I noticed the second I used it that the sound quality was much different. It sounded almost muffled, the audio levels were different, and it almost sounded as if the people talking were talking through a pair of walkie-talkies. This was very annoying and made me completely want to stop using it.The PICTURE quality of the first projector was perfect. Given that I used a good-quality screen and used blackout curtains when using the projector. The color was bright, the lines were defined, and the quality was consistent (apart from the changes from the dust build-up.) The picture quality was different on the second projector I received. The color was very muted no matter how much I messed with the settings, and the picture was much darker and even a bit blurry regardless of how much I tried focusing it. I used the second projector maybe less than a couple of hours before I just had to switch back to the first, dustier one I had.Even though it was dusty (and a bit frustrating), I eventually looked past the projected dust solely because the picture and audio quality were just that good. Over a year and a half later I am still using the first projector, but almost exclusively for background noise or for the cat's entertainment. The dust buildup has taken over more than 30% of the screen. I still am unable to clean it or even get the dust to budge. If my Roku remote didn't have voice control, I would not be able to see what I am clicking. However, I still give this projector four stars because of the great customer service and the original quality of the projector I bought. My ratings reflect the quality of the first projector. When I bought this, I paid about $65, and I can happily say I have gotten more than $65 of use out of it. The company can not help that my house has an excessive amount of cat hair and dust floating around. If there was a way of cleaning around the bulb, this projector would be perfect (if the quality was the same as the first one I received.) I still am not sure why the two projectors differed in such a noticeable way, but since it was a free replacement, I didn't care enough to be upset about it, only disappointed that I still couldn't clean my first projector.Since I bought this projector, the page has been updated quite a few times, and I am not sure if they are sending out the same product given that the title says "updated."

I put up my projector using a camera holder so I wasn't forced to buy a projector specific item. I did check that it could hold the weight of the projector. I did get this during a discount and think I made a great choice. I do need to read the instructions on using the phone rather than a laptop because it wasn't very straight forward when I tried and failed,  just showed me a projector menu and no button worked. I have no issues when I use HDMI. Visible with lighting but best when lights are off.

Update** they contacted me after a few days and sent me a replacement unit made the process very simple**This is my second one. First one picture wasn’t as bright as I would of hoped. It fell and broke so I ordered another which was great at first way brighter then the first one I had. Until 2 weeks ago after about 5 hours of use the picture would get fuzzy. I thought it was overheating since it’s hot in az. After turning it off for 30 minutes or so usually was fine but now it’s happening after 30mins - hour of use. Tried to get a replacement said visit site for help and site doesn’t even work. Smh. Guess I will have to get another brand when I get annoyed enough with this one’s problems. Really was hopi g to get a replacement.

Picture quality is good the brightness isn’t too bad however the speakers aren’t the best so I will be purchasing a sound bar. Also the start up sound this projector makes is very loud, I wish there was a way to remove it or atleast turn it down.

reviewTitle: So far so good - haven’t used much, but a little
reviewDescription: Seems decent for the money.  Setup wasn’t a headache either, got an adapter and plugged into my iPhone.
Do it
Basic, pretty good picture. Good price.

reviewTitle: Good for use in small spaces
reviewDescription: This projector works fine for small spaces, but doesn't have the best quality. It was easy to install and use.
It's a good projector. However we did not like the no Bluetooth connection, and not being compatible with Netflixs and other streaming apps.

reviewTitle: I should have gotten a warranty!
reviewDescription: I bought this projector back in April 2024 and it is now almost September of 2024. At first I was delighted with how crisp and clear the projector was. However, a week ago a burnt spot showed up on the upper left corner. I tried cleaning the projector getting the dust off of where the filter would be on the bottom of where the projector is. This did not help get rid of the discoloration of the quality of the picture. Also, there is no way of replacing the bulb to the projector as there is no possible way to take it apart with out breaking the whole projector. Stupidly I didn't buy a warranty with the projector and obviously the return time has passed which was in May. Debating on whether to buy this again with a warranty this time as I can not afford to buy a high end expensive projector. Other than the burnt spot on the upper left corner I was satisfied with this product but given I've had this since April and it does this with the burnt spot  I'm very disappointed!

This was my first projector, so I didn't expect much but, still... I bought it for my bedroom, but I don't watch much in bed, maybe a few hours every month so this unit was always kept very clean, leveled, and not overworked at all. I would've used it more if I could get it to work without frustrating the crap out of me, but it is what it is.I bought this a little over 20 months ago but was in the middle of a big move at the time, so it didn't get unboxed and set up until 3 maybe 4 months into owning it really (I stored it the whole time safely-I'm OCD on caring for my things, so I really am sure nothing harmed it while sitting dormant).Since the start it has ALWAYS struggled really hard to connect to my speakers even though it was all wired properly and there has always been a massive delay in remote to projector function (turn it on, have to wait up to 6 mins before the unit even responded and actually turned on so you had to trust it and wait).This has Bluetooth, and it only wanted to connect to my neighbor's player. We played so much back and forth reset, trying to stop my projector from cross connecting to his kid's TV, it was ridiculous! When it did connect well and play it was fine and dandy, the picture was way lower quality than a low-cost TV but at least I could see the dark scenes well, so I was happy with it. But then out of nowhere, about 3 weeks ago, the unit just stopped all functions completely. The only thing it does now is the power light comes on. THATS IT.So, if you're going to spend $50-70 depending on sales, maybe consider another projector cus I cannot suggest this one at all. I went off all the overwhelmingly positive reviews when buying this, to only be landed with something I could never trust, and always got frustrated with.

We got this projector & within two months a black spot started to develop. It’s gotten worse to the point where you can’t see most of the screen. The entire screen also glitches if it’s turned off then back on after a few minutes. You have to wait a minimum of 20 to turn it back on so it won’t glitch. We don’t have it turned on 24/7 only a few hours a night. I tried to use my warranty to replace it & have had no luck.

I ordered this and took a few days to open / utilize it because I didn’t get my iPhone hdmi connector right away . .Right out of the box it seemed okay but for some reason won’t connect to my iPhone or my iPad and just continues to load / freeze .Tried unplugging and replugging multiple times and nothing helped so I’m just assuming this item doesn’t work very great and or is not as supportive for your mobile devices.Highly disappointed.

reviewTitle: please get rid of that intro…
reviewDescription: Ive had this projector for a couple months now and it does its job. Ive never had a good projector so i cant compare it to anything. I wouldnt recommend this if youre using it for anything other than your white bedroom wall.The sound quality is so-so. Its not the best, but not the worst. Its actually surprisingly loud but it depends on what streaming service you are using. There was one where i had to turn the volume up to 100 and still couldny hear anything. Wish it could connect to a bluetooth speaker but it doesnt have bluetooth.The fan is loud and makes my room feel like a sauna, literally. I have to cover it with something because its so hot.The quality is good for a $50 projector. This definitely isnt the right projector if you plan on playing video games, you can see the pixels on the screen. The edges are blurry no matter how hard you try to make it focus but its only annoying if you are watching something with subtitles or playing gamesThe screen has been taken over by dust and its only been a couple months. I did contact customer service and they sent me a replacement no questions asked so i recommend this seller, just not this product. The replacement is this same product so it will probably only last 3 months before the screen is taken over by dust again.tbh, these things never bothered me that much except for the intro whenever you turn it on. It is so bright and you better remember to turn the volume down because it makes the most annoying intro sound. It also takes a longggg time to turn on. When i first got it it would turn on in one second but now it takes 5-10 seconds to turn on.

It's ok. I don't like that it does not have Bluetooth.  Packaging was nice.  But the picky thing I can do is connect devices.  Which is not bad but I wanted Bluetooth to connect a speaker or sound bar.  But cant do that because it needs to be plugged in.  Bummer

reviewTitle: Works fine, specs not as advertised
reviewDescription: This projector works fine.  Colors are decent, it’s easy to set up and use.  The brightness is nowhere near what is advertised (listed at 9500 lumens).  I honestly didn’t expect it to be as that would be a stupid bright projector!  But it is not bright enough to be used with the lights on, which is what I needed.  Worth a try, but at the end of the day, it ended up being a fail.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for
reviewDescription: I was a little skeptical with this, but for the price I gave it a chance. No mater what I hook it to, the picture will not focus. I have trued everything I can to adjust it. It is a great idea, just needs better adjustments.

I got two of these for my kids to watching streaming services such as Netflix, Hulu, Disney, ect. Unfortunately, it's not compatible with those streaming services. I wish I would have know before buying it. If youre using the projector for anything else- great quality imaging.
The sound is low and I can’t turn it up this is all the volume and it doesn’t have a Bluetooth option i regret not reading carefully and through moving forgot to return smh

We have already had a movie night with family and everyone was talking about how they wanted one.  The picture quality is good. It does show clearer at night but the quality is not bad during the daytime. I will be purchasing one for my daughter because she has been sneaking it to her room, lol.

reviewTitle: Great little projector, if your expectations are realistic
reviewDescription: Let's be honest, if you're expecting a $65 off-brand projector to be cinema quality sharp and bright enough to easily watch in a room with the lights on you're not being realistic in the slightest. So what is this little unit? Well, it's a fantastic "movie night" projector for a gathering of family and friends at an amazing price, but you'll need to make sure you have a very dark room (or it's very dark outside if you're having an outdoor viewing party) and you'll also need to not be a pixel snob, walking up to the screen and pointing out "eww, I can see the pixels". Yeah, you can see the pixels on ANYTHING if you get close enough.Okay, so the description says 1080p right? Yeah, well that means it can PLAY 1080p content from a microSD card or USB drive, it does NOT mean that the internal LCD is 1920x1080 pixels in resolution. Does that mean that it's not worth the price? Absolutely it is. I dare you to try to find a projector with an ACTUAL 1080p LCD for less than $300 (at the very low end).  What it means is that you'll need to chill out and accept that your little $65 projector is not going to be as sharp as the ones at the movie theater. Did you really think it would be??I don't know about you but I always look forward to getting movies on bluray after I've seen them in the theater because even the theater ones (which costs TENS OF THOUSANDS of dollars) are nowhere near as sharp as a bluray on a decent LED television, but you know what makes it cool? watching it on a HUGE screen! So if you pick this little thing up you can also grab a $20 projector screen here on Amazon and have your very own home cinema for well under a hundred bucks. This thing is easy to use, reliable, sharp (for the resolution it's capable of), and plenty bright enough in a dark room.PROS:- cheap- long life LED bulb prevents having to purchase super expensive halogen bulbs- tiny and easy to carry- has a tripod 1/4" thread on the bottom for easy mounting- has microSD, USB, VGA, HDMI, etc...- USB will power a Chromecast, so you can just plug into USB and HDMI and have a streaming home cinema- remote works well- goes from power on to ready in well under 10 seconds flatCONS:- you won't be watching it in a bright room, the darker the better- 800x480 resolution (just don't be a pixel snob)- manual is in chinglish and very sparse (but use your brain and figure it out, it's easy)

reviewTitle: Excellent, useful and very affordable little projector
reviewDescription: Easy peasy set up. Plug in the power cord and a FireStick into the HDMI port and it's ready to go. Minimum focal length is 3ft 9inches so you can use it in small spaces as well as for large screen projection. The cooling fan is unobtrusive and the picture quality is very good.. I’ve used it to watch stuff on the FireStick and browse images and photos on my MacBook through an HDMI adapter. You can easily use it to project images on to canvasses and other drawing surfaces to quickly draw in outlines. This especially useful for those of us who are not adept at free hand drawing..

I've used it to help with my rug tufting, connects great as I've plugged it into gaming laptops and gaming consoles, and accidentally dropped it a few times. The sound, video and focus are top notch. Sizing and focua change as well as other settings available. Still strong and basically new. Very happy with it.

reviewTitle: Crystal Clear Image at a Great Price!
reviewDescription: I recently purchased this projector and I'm thoroughly impressed! The image quality is sharp with vibrant colors, even in well-lit rooms. Setup was quick and easy, and the multiple connectivity options make it super versatile. For the price, it's an amazing choice for home movie nights or professional presentations. Highly recommend!

reviewTitle: For the price you really can't beat it.
reviewDescription: We were wanting something for our little girl to watch in the loft area of our house. I ran across this for $50 on prime day and decided to give it a try. The loft is pretty bright during the day but it does a good enough job to be more than watchable for her. When the sun goes down a little it's perfect. Volume is great infact my wife has to tell her to turn it down cuz we can hear it down stairs. It doesn't work with Google TV which is a little annoying but I had a extra Roku stick laying around and it worked fine. All in all for the price it's worth every penny even at full price.
We loved this! Quality for price was excellent. It is very easy to set up and use. We are looking forward to family movie days to come!
It works great for my halloween  shows.
Good for use in the living room or bedroom! Compatible with single screw mounts.

If you are just looking for a simple projector to have movie night outside or inside....this little gem is for you.  It is easy to set up and has a nice picture. We used it on our garage door and the kids loved it. We did hook it up to a larger speaker but the picture quality was perfect.

reviewTitle: Picture is Great! Sound quality is terrible!
reviewDescription: I just set up for the first time tonight. Picture is clear and set up with a DVR was pretty easy (I haven’t tried any other set up yet) but the speaker is terrible. Turned up all the way and still very faint.I will try to connect a sound bar but if that doesn’t work- I will return and get a better projector and hope for better sound.

reviewTitle: Awful screen tearing, it actually makes you a little nauseous (update: fixed with some effort)
reviewDescription: Edit: After being contacted by support, receiving about 5 different firmwares updates files by email. The screen tearing is finally gone and the image looks good. I did lost a lot of time and effort on it, and I did received a refund, so I'll upgrade a star on the review, but not all. You may end up with a working projector at the end. Just be prepared for the possible quirks. Mine had a black vga port. It seems there is more than one version beeing shipped.Original review: I didn't expected a high end projector for the price, but still, the constant screen tearing is just unbearable, I would rather have a lower resolution, dimmer projector with smooth image than this, it actually makes you a little nauseous after a while watching. I wish I could return but I lost the opportunity for that. I recorded a sample of how it looks like, just a random show from youtube.
I could not hook it up to my phone only the laptop. That was frustrating.
Was not able to use due to inability to play YoutubeTv, please issue refund. Product has been returned to seller.

We paid $89 for the unit.  We don't want to have a television in the living room, so this seemed like a good solution.  The brightness of the picture is mediocre, it is mostly useless with any lights on. The video often lags, even when the laptop it is connected to does not.  The remote control is crap, even when pointed directly at the sensor and only three feet away.  But the worst part is the audio.  The fan in the unit is very loud and the sound is tinny.  We haven't figure out how to connect external audio, but we haven't tried too hard since the video is so bad..This is likely a good unit for a kids' movie night.  I would say that we got what we paid for.

reviewTitle: Picture quality suffers on this budget level projector
reviewDescription: It's simple to use, and easy to set-up, but the picture quality is overall poor and lacks any real quality to make it a winner. The focus is touchy, so, the slightest adjustment makes it too blurry of a picture. When watching a show, the picture is grainy and lack detail in the image, making it almost unwatchable after a time. It is better suited for solid color images like a PowerPoint, not video. The speaker(s) offer only very simple audio, not any real quality. Overall a disappointing purchase.

reviewTitle: Only usable in pitch black room
reviewDescription: This thing is quite dim. Like super dim. It's fine if you have a pitch black room though. But in a room with a little ambient lighting, it is very hard to see the picture.

reviewTitle: Mirrors phone screen but not much else
reviewDescription: I purchased this projector along with the necessary HDMI converter to be able to display my phone to the wall. While everything works to actually mirror my phone (iPhone 12 Pro Max), no media will actually play. Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+, Apple TV, downloaded or streaming. This defeats the purpose and makes the unit useless. I paid $65 for a doorstop with a loud intro chime. Sigh.

EDIT: initially on day 1 I had liked it but day 2, it started making noise. Returning…Pretty loud. You’ll need to set the audio cause the factory setting one isn’t loud.It could be a little more vibrant in color but pretty decent for the price. I’m loving it so far

reviewTitle: Loud, not "mini" or "bright".  Poor picture quality.
reviewDescription: For the short time I had this stark white "mini" projector it was first of all, not very mini. Secondly, it was necessary to enter the input source every time I turned on the projector...not with the remote control but directly on the top of the machine.  If you have the projector securely installed on a wall at eyes height or hanging from the ceiling high enough to work properly this input is difficult to do every time you want to use the projector.  The third problem was the noise from the fan.  All projectors have some noise but this one advertised it's excellent and special noise suppressing features and how "quiet" the projector is...this is not true.  It is as loud as any other projector I have ever heard and the volume of the speakers needed to be raised louder than average for all audible uses of same speakers.  Not recommended.
No se puede esperar mucho de este tipo por su precio. El rango de ampliación no es lo que marca .
Great projector. Sucks that I can’t stream Netflix or Hulu from my phone because of privacy protectors. I have to hook up my PS4 to stream.

reviewTitle: Ok for tv not for presentation
reviewDescription: Not good for presentations
Doesn’t work
I return it because it was not what I was looking for I purchased a different one for a little more money and I am so glad I did
Does not play sound after only a year and half of owning it .
Have not had it more then a month and it’s acting up
The only audio that works is the HDMI input cable.  Other inputs do not have audio, only video.

reviewTitle: I tried but not very pleased.
reviewDescription: The head phone jack port area is toosmall to get jack to stay in. The navigation is not intuitive. The picture failed after less than 30 days.
El tamaño compacto lo que lo hace útil pero su calidad de imagen y luminosidad es regular.

reviewTitle: REALLY wanted it but I got duds both times BUUT seems to be a great buy
reviewDescription: I ordered this and got a faulty one that wouldn’t turn on so returned it but a week later I reallyyy wanted to give it a chance and get it again but tonight when i got it it was broken. The image was reflected strangely like doubled almost as you can see in the picture. When I opened the small back panel i saw the mirror inside was broken. ALSO the audio was scratchy for me but maybe that’s because I had to speaker? Anyways really wish it worked out for me but it didn’t both times so i dont know. It seems to work real nice tho according to other reviews

Projector itself was a great purchase! Picture quality is fantastic from small to very large even on a textured wall. My son has used it for movies, gaming and more. We did have to purchase an Apple AV adapter and an HDMI adapter separately which I did not anticipate. Now he is able to play fromHis phone, laptop and also Connect to a speaker for better sound. Highly recommend, just be prepared to purchased a couple adapters for a full experience

reviewTitle: For the price, it is a good product.
reviewDescription: Much better that going to the out door theater and trying to watch something with the whole family. Prepare food and drinks, sit down when your ready and watch whatever you want whenever you want. This projector and a screen for it paid for itself after around 4 weekends.

reviewTitle: It's a $52 projector (when electronic coupon is available) and worth every dollar!
reviewDescription: I was looking for something to replace my single-user Star Shower Window Wonderland holiday projector. For about double the money, you can purchase this projector and get unlimited uses at the holidays and have a device the will provide more fun all year long.While you can find faults with this projector, if you set your expectations where they should be and remember “THIS IS A $50 LCD PROJECTOR!” You will not be disappointed. You may even have a blast once you understand what you can do with this portable projector.If you need a home theater projector to display your favorite movies in pristine color, look elsewhere. But for hacking the holidays, sharing video in a dark room, group video gaming, and the occasional family movie night outdoors, I don’t think you can get this much fun for $50 in a projector this size.So would I recommend this projector? Oh yeah! With Amazon’s generous return policy and the low cost to entry, I don’t think a purchase will be a wrong decision in the long run. Even if you don’t like it, pack it up and give it to the kids. They’ll surely enjoy it!

reviewTitle: Good quality at a low price!
reviewDescription: This is my first projector and I must say I'm pretty impressed fir what it can do at such a low price ($55). It does not have wifi so please keep that in mind. It is fairly easy to set up and comes with a remote. The fan isn't as loud as I expected which is nice. The sound quality is decent for such a small machine. I need to figure out if I can connect speakers to it. I did notice that the corners are blurry especially something that is sub titled. I think i just need to do more adjustments on the lens. The one thing I suggest is to buy an Amazon stick currently going for $17. There you should be able to access all the streaming apps such as hulu, D+, Amazon video and netflix. Overall, I'm pretty satisfied with my purchase. I'm sure there are plenty of projectors that can perform at a higher level but this one is not bad for the price. I even bought a second one as a Christmas present for my brother.
Good projector. However every flat surface I place it on it seems a little tilted.
Todo bien
decent for price

After I set it up I noticed the screen flicked and the color would change to red. Also projector doesn’t work with Netflix not sure if this is a Netflix problem or not however the glitching snd the discoloration if the screen when it’s supposed to be a new equipment is very off putting especially when it’s pretty pricey. ($85)Update: they sent me a new projector which works just fine and even added a free external speaker. The company had good communication and worked with me to ensure I got better equipment.

Absolutely love this projector. It projects Netflix, Hulu, etc very crisp & clear. For the reviews saying it’s blurry— 100% operator error. You have to manually focus the lens during set up. Read the instructions and you shouldn’t have any issues… well… that is unless you get a haunted one too. Our projector will turn on at random hours of the night, in the middle of the day when I’m nowhere near the bedroom, etc. It doesn’t occur too often (maybe a few times a week) & it’s definitely not a matter of “accidentally” hitting the “on” button. I reached out to the company several months ago about this issue and haven’t heard back. Logically, I think I can only assume the projector is haunted— so for that reason alone, purchase at your own risk

This will not work properly unless you have a Fire Stick.Once we received the fire stick, everything in the projector worked great! Picture quality is clear. Speaker is decent, but an option to hook up to an external speaker would be helpful, since it’s not that loud.Overall very happy with the product, but again, you NEED A FIRE STICK, to enjoy the benefits!

reviewTitle: Didn’t work for me but incredible customer service
reviewDescription: *Edit 4/3/23*The vendor reached out and gave me a full refund for the product. They were very kind and helpful, including offering to send me a fire stick to fix the copywright issue that most projectors on the market run into. I still can’t get my projector to have any sound so won’t be using it, but I think it is just a dud.The picture still works but there is no sound…I emailed the vendor for support or a refund and they never got back to me. Don’t buy if you’ll need it for more than a month.
Good price for what I'm  using it for. My family was amazed at the clarity of the image as it was increased in size. Neighbors were quite impressed.
I have no complaints about this as of yet .had it for almost 7 months .still works great

reviewTitle: Great image but needs louder audio
reviewDescription: The image really surprised me, it’s more clear than what I expected. Only thing is that it would be a lot better if the audio was louder and a little more clear. I had to connect it to a bar speaker. Other than that, I really like this projector.
Really nice projector for the price. Has a tripod mount built in, which took the worry away of where to put it.
Lo único que le hace falta son más entradas HDMI solo tiene 1

I was looking for a "Quarantine pick-me-up" so decided to buy a fairly inexpensive projector to turn our garage into a movie theater. I bought this and love it so far! The remote doesn't work but all the controls the remote has is on the actual projector. It focuses and works well! Product says up to i think 180 inches and we projected on our garage door (14 foot) and it was crystal clear! It came with a free HDMI cable which was a plus. We connected the HDMI to our laptop and blue-toothed the laptop to the garage stereo system and it was just like we were there. Pulled the sofa in the garage and propped the projector on top of a ladder and it was super cool. Well worth the money!!!! I may have misread, but I thought the page said it was compatible with iphones but it is not. You have to buy an HDMI to lightening converter - and if you do this, save yourself the heartache and just buy an apple brand HDMI converter! I'm on my second return with Amazon on a HDMI converter because, well, China lol

Hooked up to my Roku device, this was a great projector option. The picture quality is clear and crisp even with lights on in the room I really like this projector size and the lenses set up the only downside to this projector was the speaker. The sound is clear but low. I know that you can hook up an external speaker, but with my previous project your purchase, the sound quality was exceptional so I was expecting more from this projector is you're looking for a quality projector and don't mind the semi low speaker. This is an amazing purchase

I use this projector in my yard.  The picture quality is good and it is bright enough to be visible at dusk (see picture).  It does MUCH better in the dark.  I need a screen instead of my ghetto white sheet but so far I am very pleased with the projector.A few notes, if you are running off of an iPad, the sound will not work for HBO Go or Netflix via the HDMI cable.  You will need to run the sound through another speaker.  I use a Bose portable speaker with a male to male 3.5mm cable.  I have an iPad air 2 so I still have the 3.5mm jack.Also, the fan is a little loud.Another issue that I didn't identify, likely my own error, is that the projector does not zoom.  In order to increase or decrease the size of the image, you must move the projector.  That isn't a major issue but can be a pain.Finally, invest in a decent tripod stand.  My lame table and uneven stone patio make it nearly impossible to get a level image.  The projector only balances on one leg.You get what you pay for with this projector but what you get is perfectly serviceable.
I was so excited about this projector. However, the power cord does not stay in the machine it just falls out! So it won’t start on long enough to even watch a full movie!
Returned it .

reviewTitle: Does not work with Netflix, Hulu, Disney, etc.
reviewDescription: Really bummed. I bought this to stream my various tv and movie apps from my phone to the projector and in tiny print inside the manual it says, “due to copyright issues Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, Disney etc. are not supported to stream from phone. It must be connected TV stick to play.”Why would I connect my tv to it?? Lol.
Just purchased and it’s not working. For the cost it’s not worth it . I’m asking for my money back. I think I might just throw it away

reviewDescription: I would avoid this projector. When trying to focus, you can't get the whole screen focused at once. There's always blurry spots somewhere on the screen.

I have no idea if this works at all because first of all it shipped to me without a power cable so I could not even test it but also this unit was clearly used and you could see scratches on the bottom.

It came on then hooked to item picture came on for a few seconds and the a black blob came in center of picture, it got bigger till you could see nothing.  Turned it off back on same thing... and unit was extremely hot to have only been on less than 5 minutes. The third time it won’t even come on ! Can’t return now since past 30 days even though it was a gift! Not happy!!

This worked just fine for about 5 months, then it suddenly started showing an HDCP error message. There was no damage done, we switched HDMI cables, nothing! Flat out doesn’t work anymore. Looks like lots of people have this issue. So if 89$ is worth it to you for 5 months of viewing get it.

reviewTitle: Works but you need a smart stick
reviewDescription: You need to get a tv then you can use Netflix and other steaming apps.

reviewTitle: Had issues but great customer service
reviewDescription: I had troubles with the first one I ordered and the company was quick to resolve issue and replace! The customer service was 100%
I actually like this projector this is my second one different brand though. It’s worth the price, great quality, prefect size, sound is great, and the performance is great.

reviewTitle: Power cord will not connect properly and keeps  falling out
reviewDescription: Power chord will not connect properly and keeps  falling out, service and deliver was great, works well, it all doesn't matter if the power cord keeps falling out ,

reviewTitle: No stereo speakers as advertised but still works pretty well.
reviewDescription: Works well, got it on sale for $57 so I can't complain too much. Mounted it on the ceiling with an $8 mount, thankful the projector has the option to flip the picture orientation.

reviewTitle: Great value for those who can temper expectations
reviewDescription: Wow. I'm not sure if I would use this projector for something as important as mobile presentations as a professional, however this little package would be a perfect travel projector if you wish to watch media or play games at a hotel room.Packaging was ok. It looks like mine was received after a couple tumbles, however the foam looked like it protected the projector and its accessories well.Starting it up was straight forward with minimal setup. Features are minimal with no keystone settings. At best expect to be able to force aspect ratios, some audio adjustments, and set time for onboard clock. The brightness of the projector leaves also a bit to be desired as well. I would not use this in a room where any lights are on.My use case will be for when I travel with my partner and we'll have the option to use FireTV or a switch with the projector pointing at a bare wall with no lights on. If you want a decent image to project to a screen or wall to consume content knowing you have to be in a dark room, you'll enjoy this just fine. Otherwise, I'd shop for a more mainstream manufacturer's projector.
Room has to be completely dark to view images
This is an easy to use projector that comes with all the cables you need.  The bulb is not very powerful, but it works fine if not too distant from the screen.

reviewTitle: Basic Projector is Blurry//WiFi One Doesn’t Support Dolby Audio
reviewDescription: UPDATE: AuKing reached out and offered to send the “new/upgraded” Bluetooth and Wifi projector. The new one has arrived and while the image is clearer and better, this new one doesn’t support Dolby Audio, meaning Disney+ and AppleTV+ have no sound, but Netflix and Hulu audio work normal. Why would the cheaper basic one support more audio sources? I looked online and found out how to change the audio source on my Apple TV from Dolby to just Stereo and that worked! Just more work. Overall the quality and setup is better in the Wi-Fi upgraded projector.PROS: I like how lightweight and easy it seems to be to use. The soft hum isn’t too loud, and it blows heat out of the side instead of the bottom which is great since it’s on a floating shelf. The sound is good enough for me since it’s above the bed and not far away. The brightness is good with curtains.CONS: However I’ve noticed I can’t get the whole frame to be clear and focused, either the top or the bottom is unfocused and blurry. It also can’t read my thumb drive, so I’ve hooked it up to my Apple TV. The blur can get distracting and make it hard to read subtitles.
It's looks  great works great not as loud  as I would  hope

reviewTitle: Overall a good projector but not exactly what I expected
reviewDescription: Overall it was a pretty good purchase. It really depends what you want to use it for because it's not as bright as one would hope and the sound quality is OK but not amazing.You can definitely enjoy family movie nights with it (which we do) but it's not really suitable for larger gatherings especially in a more open space.

We purchased this projector after reading a bunch of reviews here on Amazon. We do like the projector it is crisp and clear. The one thing that is a little annoying and we cannot seem to get it to stop is that whenever you turn it on it plays this musical tune. It is loud and longer than you would expect. We have not found a way to shut that off, but that is the only negative. It is a small but mighty machine!

I love the projector there’s some things that were a little annoying. The Bluetooth did not work to connect to anything, but I had a cable. The turning on sound of the projector is very loud but playing something would require a speaker. The colors are slightly off but that doesn’t matter to me. But over all very nice and adjustable

Worked fine for the most part as long as video quality is the least of your wants, and reading words are beneath you,”like why are you trying to read that word? The only true Pro is it only pulls about 58 watts so it and a streaming stick a 20$ 5.1dolby Vizio sound-bar from goodwill paired with the cellphones hotspot 8+old car batteries an inverter and two found solar panels you can watch movies all night under the stars or in the cabin like I did.
