Five star remote you press off it goes off and does like three other functions vol,input,menu etc. watch Idiocracy on it to get the

reviewTitle: Screen artifacts and tearing after six months.
reviewDescription: I loved this projector, until it started giving me grief with screen tearing and artifact.  When contacting the company they were apologetic, but indicated it was a known issue and advised return.  If only I could.  I do not think I can at this point.  For the price it is an amazing projector.  Very bummed this happened.The company's response is below.  I give them kudos for being honest about it and apologetic.  If they were able to fix the issue on their next projector I would buy it.  For now,  I would not recommend this projector for playing video clips or videos long term.** Edited to add customer service has been awesome.  I have no complaints about customer service.  They gave me a full refund and are still working to solve the problem.  I still think this projector is worth the price.Dear customer,When playing the edited video clip, there is smear, which is the phenomenon that the video frame rate does not match the projector after editing.We have feedback this situation to our factory. We are deeply sorry the problem cannot be solved now. Is there any possible to apply for return policy?Sorry again!SincerelyAuKing

Very happy with the projector, the quality of the picture is actually really great for the price. It’s bright and I can still see it perfectly even in a dimly lit room. The seller is responsive and willing to fix any issues you have with the purchase which I really appreciated. Definitely recommend if you’re not trying to spend an arm and a leg on a projector.
This projector is nice for the price paid. It’s supposed to come with a remote but I didn’t get it in my box.

My wife and I really love this projector.  We really enjoyed our movie night.  The projector is easy to setup and the produces an excellent picture.  Depending on the screen used the user will need to adjust the brightness and a few other settings to get the colors and saturation right.  We thought the brightness could be better, but we only tweaked it for a few minutes.  There are some nice software based adjustments that can be made to fine tune the fit of the projector to the screen.  The projection size can be reduced down to 75% of the default size nice for fine tuning so  moving the the screen around to fit the projection is not necessary .  We are using a 150 in  (~380 cm) screen; I recommend 16 feet (~4m) from projector to screen to achieve full screen.  The projector has a built in speaker which was just OK. The volume needed to be turned up to drown out the fan noise.  We, however, were not expecting much, but it was sufficient for our movie night.  I recommend a sound bar for the best sound experience.The biggest drawback was the remote.  It is line-of-site and the sensor is behind the projector.  The remote works fine, and it is a little clunky getting through the setting options.  It did not take long to get settings right.Over all we are satisfied with the projector and would recommend this unit.

reviewTitle: Was under the impression it was Bluetooth capable
reviewDescription: I purchased this and it was a complete disappointment. Won’t connect to any devices. I had to purchase additional cords and still doesn’t work. I consider myself and my son pretty competent when setting up electronics and still it won’t connect. Just when it starts to make progress it turns off completely. I chalked it off as user error and had my brother who works in IT and knows more than I do set it up and he couldn’t even get it to work. Now it’s been too long and I can’t return it.

I'm excited to use this, it'll be a great little device for watching movies, I'll be interested to see how it runs full power.I regret not opting for the Bluetooth wifi version, but that's not a huge turnoff.

I bought this projector for my kids room to be used with a Google TV dongle. I have an inexpensive bluetooth soundbar paired to Google TV as the built-in speakers were never loud enough. The picture is ok and is bright enough, even during the day. In fact, the only issue, other than the sound, I have is that the device always defaults to the input menu when powered on. This is very frustrating, especially to my 4 year old because he can not access the device to change the input. I have it mounted on a wall shelf so that he can't reach it. The Google TV remote has an input button, but it does not work with this projector. This means every time one of my kids want s to play a movie or watch Youtube Kids, I have to go into their room and reach up and find the button to select HDMI. This should default to the last input used as other projectors do. If they ever fix this with a firmware update, I will update this review.

reviewTitle: Nice projector but not great for sewing patterns
reviewDescription: Unless you have a really tall ceiling and you’re planning to project onto the floor, this projector isn’t going to work for you. I had it projecting from the ceiling onto my cutting table and that distance was too short to see the pattern clearly and adjust the scale. I don’t wanna give the projector a bad review though, because it does have a really nice picture for casting movies or the computer screen from the correct distance. It’s just not going to work for my needs, I probably need a short throw projector.

Update- AuKing reached out and sent a replacement improved projector, with an extra screen and a stand. I will hold my review on the previous projector, it was good, but had to keep the room super dark. The new one is a bit bright and has a lot of extra features. My only issue is my Bluetooth speaker to the projector has a lag that I can’t quite figure out how to fix.Shout out to the customer service.Not quite the quality I was expecting but also, didn’t pay much for it. The room needs to be very dark and still not the greatest picture even at a smaller size screen. All in all though not bad, would probably pay 20 bucks for it and let kids use it. Would recommend spending a little more money on something else.

I bought this to use in a classroom and so far, it has been bright enough to work in a classroom. Why am I giving it 4 stars? I wish it was brighter but it’s more than perfect for the price. Maybe I’m being unfair by giving it 4 stars.Inserted are 2 pictures showing how bright it is in a classroom.

I got this projector instead of getting a TV for my living room. I looked at a handful of different projectors and figured for the price of this unit with the amazon coupon I couldn't go wrong. I have only used it for about an hour so far but I feel I can already formulate an opinion. Get a TV... this projector isn't bad but its no substitution for a TV. With a TV you don't have to make your room extremely dark.Setup was a breeze but there is no way to size the screen. I set the projector on my wall behind my sofa so there would be no obstruction of view. I had to angle the unit downward using some shims on the back legs because the projection was tilted up on the ceiling and there was no way to tilt the projection downward. I was also hoping there would be a way to make the projection smaller to get better image quality but there isn't. The image is way to big for the wall I have it on and as of right now I don't have a projector screen. I am worried if I get a projector screen that the screen will be to small for the image.I can get the focus dialed in pretty well in the center or on the edges of the image but not the entire image all together.Also the fan is SUPER LOUD! the speaker quality isn't great but it is loud enough to over come the extremely loud fans.If you want a portable projector this one isn't bad for the price and I am still going to mess with this one to work for me since TV's are triple the price or more.If you do purchase this unit be aware there is only 1 HDMI port, I wish it had at least 2 but you can always buy a HDMI switch which is what I'll be doing and I will be connecting a better sound system to the unit.

The customer service team was able to send me a working device and this does work. I’m now amending my previous review to reflect that correction. Details of my issue/previous review below:Top of screen is slanted/can’t produce a full image.After a back and forth with customer service, my last response was:You’ve sent me a video illustrating troubleshooting steps which I had just done and what I communicated to you, that I had already completed. Your troubleshooting steps didn't work. This projector, right out of the box, doesn’t work.I’ll put your note here though in my return/review. This way, potential consumers can see that your company knows very well that you are selling projectors that (as you wrote) have a “lack of horizontal keystone correction” and that instead of fixing this deficiency or informing consumers of this before purchase, you are selling projectors that produce a “rhombus” frame as opposed to a full square projection.This way consumers can decide for themselves if they want to buy a new projector that cannot produce a full square projection or not. Had I known this, I would not have bought this projector and I hope to save anyone else from all this huge waste of time, money, back and forth, etc.
the cooling fan is noisy, besides that its not bad at all.
It's as expected for the price.

This is a great little projector for the money. But it is missing a lot of features like four-way keystone. You can only adjust the keystone up and down. It is lacking a lot of adjustments for contrast brightness saturation etc. The outside edges of your screen will be blurry. You can get the center focused but you will always have blurry edges no matter what you do. When you are watching movies or YouTube or something like that you do not really notice it that much. But when you have it hooked to a laptop and your desktop is showing or you're trying to do presentations with lettering on the screen you will not be able to read the lettering around the outside of your screen. But for 69 bucks it's a nice little projector. I was projecting on 110-in screen at 10 ft away. The customer service I have to say is awesome. The first one they sent me was missing a remote, believe it was a used unit. They immediately sent me a new one. So I really appreciate it the customer service.
Apenas me llegó hoy, lo probé en la oficina que es bastante clara y se veía bastante bien. El sonido es aceptable para el tamaño del aparato. Espero que resulte útil para las reuniones de trabajo

From the description/photos one expects to be able to use it with your devices out of the box.  This is far from the case.  It has 3 cables: power (obviously), an hdmi to hdmi cable and one of those old-school yellow-red-black cables that you might need if you wanted to project directly from your VCR (you still have one of those right?).So, unless your smartphone or laptop has a hdmi slot (unlikely) you will not be able to use this projector out of the box.  You will be stuck with going out and buying various cables (lightning to hdmi, usb to usb, etc.) before you can use it.The whole point of buying things on amazon is to get them fast and use them immediately.  It was faster to just return the product.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for.
reviewDescription: Garbage. From 8’ to 20’ the image is only in focus in the center 24”. Keystone is only vertical so the unit just gave directly at the projection surface and. It even from a slight angle. Very dim and must be used in a completely dark room. Not great for presentations where people need a bit of ambient light to take notes. Very grainy display so forget about projecting to a painted wall or any other surface that a silver or projection screen. Unit is dubbed as portable but unless you travel with high quality screen, count on grainy, out of focus, and dim images. I will be returning this item. I got this cheap thinking it would suffice for impromptu office meetings or when traveling but I’ll spend the extra money. Don’t waste your time or money.

This has terrible a blurry picture. I would not waste your money on this purchase. I bought this and kept thinking of ways to helpImprove it but I just can’t figure it out. It is not bright at all so very hard to even see anything. Setting up was a mess bc I had nothing to look at while setting up, it just isn’t worth the money. Try something else!
The picture on the screen is horrible. How do I get assistance with using this equipment or return it?

reviewTitle: Stopped working after only using it 4 or 5 times
reviewDescription: This projector seemed great and worked well the first 4 or 5 times we used it. We have not been able to get it to work since then. So disappointed!

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for...
reviewDescription: I expected more from this projector based on the positive reviews. This is my first projector purchase, but I'm familiar with using other devices at work. The image isn't as clear as I hoped for. Maybe the more expensive, B-15000 versions would have suited my expectations better...

reviewTitle: This thing was worst than junk
reviewDescription: All I wanted to use this for was to transfer artwork onto large canvases/walls and the picture quality was so bad, I couldn't even just use it to project a black and white drawing for tracing. I didn't even try to do anything else with it, because the quality was so poor! This is misleading - there is no way you will get anything near when they show in the product photos as their "simulated picture". So thankful for Amazon's easy returns on this one!

The projector has okay quality video but it came with a dead pixel and a lot of light leakage that creates glare on white parts of the videoThe picture shows the dead pixel and the other is the mouse and you can see how it glaredI also tried to go to the service hub and the website was not available :(

I ordered this as a gift for someone and they just opened it and no remote. No Bluetooth capabilities either which means buying additional supplies for this to work with a phone. Only HDMI and AV cords! But I real upset about not having a remote!

Used 3 times and is already bad since is making lot of weirds noises and video been delayed, I don’t have that much time to spend at home and that is why we just used it like 3 times and now I bad. Return window already expired, great way to loose $65. Very bad
Update: gave 3 stars because seller totally resolved the issue, excellent customer service!I'm so bummed, this doesn't work and picture quality is bad, very dark. It's too late for me to return now.

reviewTitle: Set up and directions difficult to understand
reviewDescription: Directions are poorly worded and difficult to understand.  Extra wires are needed unless you are doing HDMI to HDMI.  It would have been good if the listing stated what extra wires are needed so they could be purchased when purchasing the projector.

I actually had to send this projector back I had every intention of using it with a USB drive that had movies on it. Unfortunately when I plug the drive into it it didn't recognize the movies I was trying to play. It's saw the file structure but it would not allow the files to play. I read through the manual and yes I was using the correct and supported formats. Unfortunately I had to return it cuz it didn't suit my purpose. I realize this product has great reviews however when you buy the product you will get a free gift if you give it a four or five star review which makes the review process tainted in my opinion.
Not sure what I was really expecting for $80, but no way is this 1080. I will use it for fun around the house, but purchased an LG for presentations when traveling.

Getting the position right so you can see the images can be quite a challenge. Can be Very difficult to get this into focus.I had high hopes but think it will be collecting dust more than being used.Doesn't work with all usb's, it has been hit or miss with the 30 or so I have.

reviewTitle: Does not come with the thing to connect your phone
reviewDescription: It has all these things to connect to but not for your cell phone to connect. You have to buy a separate cord for that. I would have thought you could connect your phone with the USB port like with a computer. That was not the case. You would think it would come with the cord to connect a phone.
The cord broke and I went to the website provided by Amazon. It takes me to website for human hair wigs??? Anyone know how to replace the cord?

reviewTitle: 3 stars: RCA jack output doesn’t work, remote too sensitive
reviewDescription: First impression is that it’s ok.  I gave 3 stars because the rca jack input doesn’t work.  I tried 2 different DVD players & 3 separate sets of cords (ones they included, 2 of my own) and I get nothing, or I get a few seconds of static.  So I’m  limited to HDMI.Another star knocked off because the remote is too sensitive.  It has to be within a foot and pointed directly at the sensor to work.  That’s not going to be very convenient.Picture is ok, setup is ok, sound is iffy but IMO that’s to be expected.  There’s an output to hook up something better.

reviewTitle: Is saving a few bucks really worth the terrible picture quality?
reviewDescription: Not terrible for occasional use at an outdoor event or tailgating but if this is to be used in place of a television and will be viewed daily then do yourself a favor and she'll out a few more ducketts! Picture quality as well as audio adaptability substantially decrease when you try to save a few bucks and though not universally true, when it comes to electronics the quality of a device is closely tied to the price of said device. I'm hoping to return this to Amazon and pay the going rate for a upper mud level machine because I've learned my lesson. The message is if course, " Never. Pee on an electric fence!" Lesson learned!
Is not compatible with fire stick or Roku. Shows really good. Haven’t put up the screen it goes on yet. Volume connects well w laptop.

reviewTitle: Not great for movies from phone
reviewDescription: I’ve bought three adapters, none of them can stream movies from my phone.Unless you’re connecting this to a laptop with a speaker connection, don’t get this.If you’re presenting a PowerPoint, this one would probably work pretty good.TLDRNot good for backyard moviesProbably good for PowerPoint

reviewTitle: Keeps getting lagged and having to restart it
reviewDescription: Package was nice and the simple setup was easy. However, when I’m playing it, it keeps getting lagged and it freezes. I have to constantly restart it. Why?

This projector is great for a totally dark room, but is not what you might be looking for, if you want a projector for presentations in a meeting setting. The picture quality is very clear, but you cannot have any light in the room if you want to be able to view the projection.

reviewTitle: Didn’t come with remote & no longer detects usb
reviewDescription: I’m very disappointed! I got this thing new and to be honest I got it in 2019 but just opened for my Moms memorial slide show. First my fault for not opening right away but it did not have a remote. Secondly I put my USB with the video and it detected it the first time but will no long detect the same USB video minutes later.Update: A customer service representative contacted me to address my concerns and sent me a new remote.
Not bluetooth. Needed for art project

The lamp is dim and the focus is not uniform. If the center of the image is in focus, the edges are blurred and vice versa.UPDATE: The company has been very responsive to my concern, sending me a replacement projector. The new projector has a brighter image, but the focus issue remains a problem. According to them, this is a common issue, but I have higher-end projectors that do not have the same problem. I do not know whether other portable projectors have a similar problem with focus

I bought this product after seeing positive reviews, and even a picture of someone using it outside for a family movie night. It's cheap enough that I took the risk on ordering it, but after receiving it I could not be more disappointed with the picture. The picture quality is that of a 1980's television. Do not buy this product if you plan to use it for anything professional (presentations, screenings, etc.). It is good enough for having an outside movie night with kids I guess since they won't care about HD or picture quality. Just make sure that it is absolutely pitch dark outside. If you can afford it, get a better one. I live abroad in Africa, so unfortunately cannot return this product. Would if I could.UPDATE: The company contacted me directly and refunded my money. I am very impressed. When a customer does not get what they wanted, they ought to be refunded. They were very fast and really seem to care about customer satisfaction.

The projector seems good but I have to deduct a couple of stars because they play games to skew the reviews here. Look at the pictures. They offer prizes for reviews and I believe that makes things worse for everyone.If we can no longer trust the reviews from other shoppers, we will end up buying worse products than we thought. Even if they don't explicitly ask for positive reviews, we all know that's what will happen.Auking, if you trust your product's quality, stop soliciting feedback in exchange of gifts and let your consumers express their unbiased opinions.

I didn't expect this to be a super amazing quality because of what it is, but we can't even use it. The picture is super grainy or blurry, and its loudddd. It is so loud, and you have to buy a special connector just to use it for your phone which is the whole point. Also the speaker on it is terrible

I bought this primarily for giving indoor Powerpoint presentations.  Connected it to my laptop and had it working in just a few minutes.  Note that the remote only controls the projector adjustment settings, not the laptop, so you can't change slides remotely.  Also, using this for Powerpoint presentations only works in a room with little or no lighting.  Otherwise it is very hard to see the slides.  It probably works fine for outdoor projection after dark, but sadly it is not a good choice for indoor use if the room cannot be darkened.

reviewTitle: Used only a handful of times and now it wont work at all
reviewDescription: I bought this over a year ago but have not used it very much. Last night i went to turn it on and nothing happened. I was very disappointed in the longevity of it as i only used it a handful of time. Save your money and buy something that will actually last.
Straight out the box the projector has a black mark that cannot be removed. Either a scratch or an issue with the bulb.

I was really excited to give this a try. I got it yesterday and checked it out while at work. Came to find the remote was missing. I put it all back in the box and went on to try the projector at home. The size of picture is good, but thats about it.I reached out to the company yesterday and they have yet to respond about the missing remote. After seeing how NOT bright the picture actually is and the missing remote, I will just be returning the whole thing and trying something else.

It was working fine for a couple months and then the last few days, it has had so many issues connecting. The audio will work and the video won’t, or the video will work and the sound will be dead. This sucks and I’m so incredibly angry because I've used 3 different HDMI cables, deleted and redownloaded the apps I was streaming on, turned the stupid thing on and off to reset it and the same damn result: NOTHING. On top of that, when the audio does work, there’s a constant high pitched sound coming from the speakers, even at a low volume like 20-30.This device is a piece of crap, don’t waste your money on it.

I don't know how a product like this is even allowed to be sold. You have to turn this thing on and off in hopes of getting it to MAYBE work. I've tried HDMI, VGA, and USB connection to no avail. Half the time, it doesn't project, the other half, it won't connect. The remote becomes unresponsive after a few seconds and the buttons on the device itself do nothing. It's as if the thing is overheating in the first minute within being on.Customer service is nonexistent. The "support website" link listed through Amazon takes you to a wig website??

First i had to return the projector right away because the first box sent to me had been previously owned and was missing pieces and in bad shape so that was an immediate hassle. Next was when i hook the new one up to a laptop or another input source it looks verys blocky and the text isnt right. Ive tried troubleshooting and everything but it just seems like the quality through hdmi isnt all there yet. Very easy to setup and adjust though.

I set mine all up and it just didnt work. I had the hdmi set up to my laptop which is farely new and never had any problems. Once i plugged it in, it would show my computer screen, then it would show HDMI no signal... every five seconds. Back and forth constantly between mirroring and no signal. Cant do anything with that. I was going to get a replacement but i figured it wasnt worth it because the picture quality wasnt great and the sound is below average unless u set up speakers which im sure that wouldnt work either. Im going to go to Best Buy because even though they are over priced at least their stuff works.
I am unable to get in contact with seller. The display has a black hole in the middle of the screen and troubleshooting has not helped. Also there is no Bluetooth as advertised.

reviewTitle: Not A Viable Tool For Artists Purposes
reviewDescription: I had previously read that this thing could project STILL images, so I purchased it to project sketches and photos on to my canvas. I thought this was a more environmental option, and perhaps easier to use, but yeah, I was wrong.This projector is a PIA. Not only do the menus absolutely suck, but I tried 3 different USB sticks before it finally decided to acknowledge that I had one in, and then for whatever reason, it wouldnt project my JPEG images because they weren't 'supported'. Well there simply isn't a more basic file format than JPEG, so I futzed around with it for a couple more minutes and then boxed it up for a return.Truth is, there's just no substitute for old-school overhead transparencies. I was trying to get away from that, because ultimately it's pretty wasteful, but for painting purposes, nothing works better.IMO this thing is absurdly overpriced, and underengineered and I don't recommend it for anything more than a kids playroom projector.

reviewTitle: Cannot resize or reshape other than to move the projector itself
reviewDescription: Must change the distance of projector to change size of screen cast. Also no option to change the shape for casting from a low or high position, or diagonally placed to the screen. Must the place the projector directly in front of the screen at the exact distance it takes to accomplish the screen size you need. In my case, this meant putting the projector 6’ high in the middle of the room, in front of the couch, completely blocking the screen from the couch. Dealbreaker. I should be able to place this projector anywhere in the room (in reason) and be able to manipulate the image casted to fit and fill the screen. Will be returning.
The projector is cute and compact, very portable, but not bright at all.It might work well in a totally dark room, but not in the presence of light.

Built in speaker won't work with any input, more than 2m projections is extremely dim in a pitch black room, remote controls needs to be less than 1m to work properly. I know it's a cheap unit and it didn't promise me the moon and stars but I expect at least what is advertised. I shouldn't have to paint my windows with black paint just so I can see the image clearly. It's too bad about this...once I get some actual brightness out of the image, the scaling down for the 1080p image to the native 400p resolution actually looks good, all things considered.

I got this projector about a week ago and thus far it works half of the time. It is absolutely great with its sound quality and clarity. . . when it works. The other half of the time it does not says that it is connected, but nothing shows up or it says no signal when my device says it is connected. Additionally, I tried asking the company to get help with it's warranty to ask about ways to fix problems and still have no reply after several days. It is such a disappointment that I am going to return it and try for another projector.
After 2 months of usage when I attempt to play video from a USB it does not respond. I have to unplug it from the power source and plug it back in and then it responds.
You can only hear sound from the projector it doesn’t connect to anything! Playing a louder sound while watching a movie is out of the question

Opened it up, noticed the box the contained the power cord and remote was tore. The power cord was not factory wrapped up. There were finger prints on the lens, missing the lens cover. Remote packaging was not sealed.

reviewTitle: No sound for Prime or IMDb TV, or Netflix
reviewDescription: I love my projector for the most part. Just irritates me that I can't watch EVERYTHING I want. It doesn't have sound at all for the movies on prime but it shows the picture. Same for IMDb Tv. Haven't tried Netflix yet. I was told to buy a surround sound system and to hook the fire stick to the system then hook the system up to the projector. Shhhessshhhh sounds like a lot just to watch movies. but everything else is good !

reviewTitle: NOT FOR USE WITH HOLOGRAPHIC PROJECTION
reviewDescription: I purchased this to project a hologram on a rear screen. First: even at Max brightness it's outshined by any external light source. Clarity from 10 ft away is the best you'll get. At 20 ft it's barely noticeable. I tried different screens made specially for this and all had the same result. Neat little projector for a bedroom or something, but not very powerful.

reviewTitle: The screen projects distored rectangle. Hard to get it right
reviewDescription: The projector is limited: the monitor has to be at a perfect height to project the screen in a rectangle that is in anyway like a TV screen enlarged, and the quality of focus is also low if the room isn't pitch dark.

The projector gets the job done, but if you are streaming movies, shows, etc. the sound is very low, making it extremely difficult to get a true watching experience. Must be augmented with external bluetooth speakers.

reviewTitle: Company should warn buyer about the items I listed.
reviewDescription: The projector lamp  isn’t bright enough for full daylight and barely bright enough for semi-dark. The size and weight are great but we should have been warned about brightness. Also the buyer should have been warned thAt they don’t recommend this projector for slide shows & I can’t get the remote to work at all.

I bought this projector a week before a movie night I was hosting in order to have time to test it in advance. it worked when it arrive but gave out 2 hours before the movie was scheduled to start. I had to run to Walmart to get another one. I had to return it

reviewTitle: I expected a more stable consistent picture
reviewDescription: Works okay, good brightness. Picture is ruined by a severe ripple anytime the frame or a character moves its very distracting to the point of almost being unpleasant to watch on. Expected more, had better picture on $24 mini projector.

it was so dull in brightness and you can't sharpen the whole image just the edges or the middle not both. OK for kids cartoons but I watch horror movies which are all mostly night shot and I couldn't watch a bright sunny movie. Lame.

reviewTitle: Having a very hard time getting anything to work. Very frustrated
reviewDescription: The directions make it seem so easy and it is jit easy at all

reviewTitle: Did not come with hdmi cable
reviewDescription: No hdmi cable

This projector is a major letdown. Very cheaply made, hard to adjust, not very clear or bright, overall everything I was hoping it wouldn’t be. I bought a projector screen to see if that would help but it didn’t.

reviewTitle: I couldn't connect my phone with the projector
reviewDescription: I was trying to connect by somehow my phone thru bluetooth or cable, but I was unable to. It was pretty difficult to set it up, and the size of the projection was pretty small.
Item came in and needed extra cables that I bought separately and then it never worked with projecting. Waste of money.

Center of the projector is focused while out of it blurs and fades away. You can see the pixels in affect on the wall. In complete darkness is when the projection works best. Controller works only when pointing infront of the sensor. Fan is louder than the speaker.

reviewTitle: It only will work for 10 minutes
reviewDescription: I was excited when I first set this up and started a movie.  But it abruptly stopped working after 10 minutes.  It just stopped on a frame and wouldn't start back up.  So I tried a different movie, and the same thing happened.  Then I tried a different source thinking it was my hard-drive, and still the same issue.  The quality of picture and sound is good otherwise.  I just am not able to enjoy a full movie.

I got it because it showed that I could use it with my laptop. I followed theinstructions to a T. It brings up the menu but I can't get it to go to anything on the menu to tell it whatI want it to connect to. I have been told that I need to get a different connection, that the HDMI will not work. I have ordered the VGA. If that dosent work,you will be getting it back.
It will only focus in the middle but the top and bottom remain out of focus. Tried different angles but it will not be fixed.
Got home excited to open it! And boom there is something on the lense. I tried cleaning it inside and out and nothing. Definitely returning.
Did not work well outdoors.

reviewTitle: Will not allow streaming apps to play on it.
reviewDescription: Im a little disappointed this projector won’t allow movies or shows from streaming apps to play.

After about a month of daily use the fan starting making extremely loud winding up that only goes away after i give it a good few taps on the side.Other than that, not real issues.... Other than the small bit of plastic that was blocking some of the projection internally. ...Worth 40usd? Sure, if you're not broke. Should you wait for a better one? Yes...

reviewTitle: Suitable for kids movie night on a budget ( room must be dark)
reviewDescription: This projector is usable in a dark room only and you can expect 720p image quality on a 80”-90” screen size.I do not expect the best picture or the best brightness due that  I’m not paying as minimum $200 for a better projector.The most important for me is that the product is affordable, easy to use and good at 720p.

reviewTitle: Returned - cannot be used with business applications like Office Suite programs
reviewDescription: This item has been returned. No where in the description did it indicate that it could not be used with business applications like the Office Suite programs. Had so much difficulty trying to get it to work, and then notice the TINY print in the instruction manual that said this. Very disappointed, as the item was purchased to project a PowerPoint slideshow at my son's graduation party.

reviewTitle: Compact form. Mediocre picture quality. Terrible flickering
reviewDescription: Started flickering every 30 seconds when connected via HDMI cable to my MacBook. Very annoying to watch anything with this.

reviewTitle: OK but noisy and not bright as expected
reviewDescription: Got it for fun. Not bright enough as expected. Every single light has to be turned off to see the pictures. It gets really hot which caused my ROKU stick to occur an error by the heat even though the very noisy fan is on all the time. You need to purchase a nice speaks to cover the noise.

It's exceptional, not so bright and focus is not really clear than I expected. I don't know if it's only me has the problem when it comes to sharpness but based on what I saw it's not as what I expected. For the price is good but the features is not more than what you pay for.

It works and if it’s all you can afford then I would get it. It’s good for a starter projector. Easy to set up, I’m using it on a tripod. The color isn’t the best, the brightness isn’t very good. Don’t expect a vivid picture. It’s only good to pull out from time to time I wouldn’t use it daily.

reviewTitle: You pay for what you get.
reviewDescription: Everything on this would be average, its not the best projector in the world and I knew this going in so it works for how I need it to work.  Only thing noticeable is the extremely loud fan noise and heat.  But overall Im pretty satisfied.
Must be completely dark to be able to see what’s on the screen. There has to be zero light but when it’s dark pictures great.

The projector is doing it's job right now.  My only real complaint is that the images projected are ALWAYS slanted.  It's as though one side is higher than the other but we have looked and measured, the projector itself is leveled.  I would greatly appreciate a word from the seller or someone who has experienced this.

reviewTitle: Seller was great for refund-Amazon not great
reviewDescription: This projector wasn't durable for use with document camera. It wasn't bright enough and had blurry edges. I wish there was a way to ask seller to return the power source for my document camera that we accidentally mailed back with this projector. Amazon doesn't have a way to actually talk to or contact a real person! Very frustrating!

reviewTitle: Save your money and buy better quality
reviewDescription: For an outdoor showing this works well, to use it inside it needs to be very dark and you have to mount it on a high table or stand as well as finding a sweat spot distance wise otherwise the picture is distorted. In hindsight I regret this purchase.

reviewTitle: Good projector for the price point.  Do not expect HD quality as this is not an HD projector
reviewDescription: Good projector for the price point.  Do not expect HD quality as this is not an HD projector
It’s bigger than I expected and I can’t use it until I get the correct adapters

Very slow I bought the hdmi connector so I could use the projector for my iPad and iPhone to play Netflix and all those online streaming services and it does not work. It won’t okay the shows it plays YouTube goes online like a shared screen but when I try to play from Netflix Hulu or prime it stops working.
Bought this for my teens bedroom. Set it up, had to go buy a lightening cable at Best Buy ($50!). Finally got it working and kept glitching. Not as happy as we hoped to be!

reviewTitle: Developed issues right after return period ended
reviewDescription: I was enjoying it as a cheap projector but now sometimes it randomly glitches and gets stuck as shown in the pictures. Very unfortunate this happens right after return period.

reviewTitle: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR
reviewDescription: Doesn't work right out of the box.  Followed instructions.  Start button does not fire up the device.

reviewTitle: The picture tells you what I think of this
reviewDescription: From the moment it arrived it did not do anything that it said. It does not work with a DVD player, there is no ability to control it. It would not work with an ipad pro. All of the characters are in Chinese. Buy something else or burn it.

This projector is trash. I bought it back in June 2021 and just brought it out the box and it doesn’t duplicate the screen when hooking up my HDMI cord they sent to my laptop and the projector. Out of the many times I’ve tried it only worked ONCE. This projector is complete TRASH and I would NOT recommend for the amount of money you spend on it. I am so disappointed. Spend the extra money for a better one. I even went on YouTube to see reviews of it and it seems they run into the same issue. Don’t buy. I seriously regret it

This projector is falsely described as 'full hd 1080p' or elsewhere in the description it is described as 1080p supported or something like that. None of that is true actually, as the projector has native resolution of a tube tv from 1994. Then imagine enlarging your 1994 tv about 10 times and guess what it looks like? Any positive review of this projecter seems suspect to me. Do not buy this and look for one that is at least 1080p native resolution because this one is a scam.
Waste of money. I purchased the adapters and it still didn’t work. I got this projector two years ago as a Christmas gift, it is disappointing that it doesn’t work. DO NOT BUY!

Picture is blurry and choppy. Also image has a slight slant to it you can't get rid of. Cheaply made. Not HD by any means. No quality control.Update: I just received the "free gift" tri-pod which is absolutely not what is pictured in the pamphlet and is completely worthless. This company has no standards whatsoever. The company rep also informed me that I had to change my review to 5 star in order to receive this free gift. All the positive reviews are just a ruse to get their gift which, no apologies here is absolute crap.
I’ve used for only a week and will not only run for 4 minutes then turn off for 16.
Great picture quality,Size,Connectivity,Happy with my purchase ,Fast shipping, Entertainment Value 💯😊Would definitely buy again, Compatibility
very good product! If you need projector, buy this one!
Easy set up and picture is very clear!

Do NOT have high expectations on these budget projectors. If you expect to project 2k/4k sharp quality, spend more money elsewhere.For the money, I think this small projector packs a punch if you don't want to dish a load of money on a new TV or an expensive projector.  This is my bedroom budget theater setup for under $150:-$70 Auking (price will vary, got mine during Black Friday sale)-$25 Amazon Fire stick (turn your projector into a smart TV, you can also mirror your phone and stream anything through your smart phone w/ the Fire Stick)-$30 Insignia computer speakers for better sound quality (optional, projector has builtin speakers)-suggestions: buy an inexpensive ($20 or less) HDMI switch if you plan on having multiple HDMI sources such as gaming consoles, this way you won't have to keep swapping HDMI cords for the projector's single HDMI port.-$9 surge protector, I advise getting at least a 6-outlet to plug in all of your devices.The pictures I included show how bright the projector is in a dark room vs during the day with light coming through a window shade. My projector is set 10 feet away from the adjacent wall, sitting on a shelf above my bed, at this distance it is projecting a 98 inch screen (the further the projector, the larger the image).Pros: easy setup, inexpensive, so far it has lasted hours of use for the last 3 months (I have a 70" Sony TV that I hardly use since this came around)Cons: projector's focus adjustment could use more fine tuning, some small area on the outside edge are difficult to adjust to project a clear and even image throughout.
so easy
Works as described

My husband and I wanted a projector for a while now and finally pulled the trigger on this one due to the price and solid reviews. I agree with others that you need to temper your expectations - you cannot expect $3K quality for an under $100 price point, but for our desired purpose (kids movies, travel, etc.) it is great. Our kids are 2 & 3 and we hope to do some camping (even just backyard camping) next summer and look forward to using this along with a projector screen to make it an extra special memory for the kids. We had no issues connecting this to a variety of devices and taking it through the wringer with our test of it and would definitely recommend if you are looking for a projector that won’t break the bank.

I wanted a somewhat portable projector for my small loft living room I have and this turned out so perfect! It is small enough to be mounted in my banister and it has all the different ports to connect with an iPhone or computer (I did my Nintendo switch) they also Provide you with two different connection cords to start off! The screen quality surprised me as well you can adjust the sharpness of the screen and zoom in and out!! Very good for a start up basic projector was easy to assemble and use :)

This projector is awesome. Use it for a home theater! Plug in a cell phone to the device and stream a movie onto a wall or canvas. Easy to transport, easy to use, and worth the money spent. A+A+A+A+ item!!
Having the best time with this projector really impressed ~ just get one ~

Edit. The customer service from this company was awesome! Upon hearing of our problems with the original projector they shipped us out a new one ASAP. Good product good team!Projector purchased here was an upgrade from a previous purchase, different brand. That projector had 480p so the picture clarity was amazing. The sound was iffy at first but we have adjusted to it, until today when it sounds like the speakers inside the projector are blown? Crackly, difficult to hear dialogue, overall a disappointment since we loved it before this.

reviewTitle: Doesn’t load the movie on my phone
reviewDescription: Sure, it’s a good projector, but I purchased a separate HDMI cable and I connected it to my phone. When I had my phone unplugged, my movie played but as soon as I plugged it to the hdmi cable, it stayed loading. I don’t know what’s wrong with it but I can’t play anything on it! I tried disney, hulu, netflix, youtube and none of them loaded when plugged to the hdmi attached to the projecter

reviewTitle: it works great for a few months
reviewDescription: I'm a truck driver I use this almost every day and it was great for about 3 months. then I started noticing a mark on the screen and a week later that mark turned into a black spot on the screen. I have a lot of tech exp so I took it apart and the back screen is a cheap plastic screen so obviously the image burned into the plastic. sadly I had to buy a new projector this is a good cheap projector for light use but don't buy this if you are going to use it a lot it won't last.

reviewTitle: Need extra supplies, Doesn’t directly support Netflix
reviewDescription: Cons: I didn’t realize I would need to get an extra 10-15$ adapter to hook my phone/iPad up. I didn’t realize you can’t directly use Netflix / Hulu / Disney from your device. You have to use a Roku or other stick device - which then means I need a hotspot to hook up internet. I spent 30 minutes messing with this, and I’m so frustrated I don’t even want to use it at this point. Very hot air blowing out of it as well.Pros- video quality is ish okay from what I saw.
mine came with a defective speaker, so low audio, but good visual.
You get what you pay for. I found this doesn’t get super bright and image quality leaves a lot to be desired. For the price it works well enough, but for a bit more you can probably do better.

reviewTitle: Will have to constantly replace it
reviewDescription: It’s nice the first month or so then it’ll grown this black spot and I replaced it with the same one and the same outcome occurred again, but I’ve reached my expiration date for customer support with this product so now I must find a new company. Be careful!!

reviewTitle: I purchased this AuKing because it had a higher lumen count, but I couldn't keep it in focus
reviewDescription: I searched for a projector that would display my computer screen for business meetings  - one with a high enough lumen count to actually see what was projected. Many cheaper brands sounded good, but had very low lumen statistics, so the projection would be very dark, or you'd have to be in absolute darkness to see anything. I couldn't bring myself to purchase anything under about $130.I purchased this "AuKing Projector, 2023 Upgraded Mini Projector, 9500 lumens Multimedia Home Theater Video Projector" and while I could see the projection in medium light due to the 9500 lumens, I could not get the entire screen to remain focused. This projector had a great-sounding feature that would compensate if a projector was pointing slightly upwards or downwards towards the screen, and would allow the screen projection to be a near-perfect rectangle, however I could not keep the center and sides of the projection in focus - I'd either lose the center, or the left/right sides.I'm thankful that AuKing accepted my return of their projector, so I gave them an extra star for good customer service, but I would not buy this product again.

reviewTitle: It’s ok.  For $70 it’s 3 stars.  The one I got is worth 2 stars
reviewDescription: It’s ok.  If I’d gotten a better manufactured one I’d give it 3 stars for the $70ish dollars I paid.  My remote doesn’t work and the fan is lousy, but I’ll probably return it for a replacement and hope it’s better.First of all, it’s not like a great projector.  It’s decent.  It’s not great at blacks, if it’s fast transitions it kind of lags.  Speakers are bad.  And it has to be perfectly dark to be worth it.  My weather station said 7 lux when I started the movie outside, and that was about the minimum acceptable.  You don’t want much or any light pollution.But throw a cheap screen, and a cheap external speaker on it and the kids will be thrilled.  An Amazon basics tripod is a worthy $13 investment as well since it isn’t too heavy and screws right on.That aside, you can do an outside movie night and make the kids happy super cheap.  And that’s where this thing shines.Oh, and the digital rights management stuff makes this thing a giant pain.  Some stuff works, some doesn’t.  It is really hit or miss.  My iPhone plays Disney plus most of the time if I open it a certain way, but not movies I purchased through iTunes.
Can’t hardly hear even when turned all the way up. Hard to get it to match screen size.

reviewTitle: Does not mirror to any streaming app
reviewDescription: I set this up correctly with all the right cords and components including the special apple piece for my phone (does not plug into a new macbook air because you'd need a usbc to usbc since the video set ups aren't up to date with macbook air outlets. No matter what streaming service I chose it did not mirror. The only time I got any sort of function was hearing a show from Prime on the projector without being able to see it. I'm super disappointed with projector situation.

-I'm not sure what the point of the USB port is for if I can't attach to my smart phone.-The remote did not work.-I plugged in my fire stick into the home port....nothing.Update: I realize I didn't provide a full description. Here it goes. I bought this "near the cheaper end of the projector market" projector because I don't plan on using it much. However, I expected it to be fairly easy to use. The Reference Guide is a waste of paper, I could easily figure our how to attach what to what and use the buttons to select what I wanted to use. But once I select the input device nothing comes up. It just says no signal.When I realized I could not use my phone for the usb port which is a bummer because I had planned on taking this camping with us, I tried using my firestick in the hdmi port and nothing...no signal.I bought an HDMI adapter for my cell phone... no signal.I went to process the return on Amazon and the company will not let you. They have emailed me and asked me to plug it into my home computer. I do not own a home computer. I own tablets and a cell phone. They are sending me a free wifi hdmi cable which is very nice of them but they are in China and it will take 2 weeks for it to be delivered.I just asked them to please allow me to return the item because it's much more a hassle than I needed and I'd rather spend the money on a more expensive projector.

reviewTitle: Perhaps okay for shorter throw distance but longer throw distance is an good
reviewDescription: The image quality for shorter throw distance is acceptable for the price. However, the longer throw distance is a different story. I tried with ~13' throw distance and the focus wouldn't work evenly for the entire image. Part of the image would in focus but the edges and corners wouldn't be in focus. The zoom functionality lacks usability. One would most likely need to use zoom when using longer throw distance. When zoom is used in less than 100%, it would leave visible low light band around the image like frame. The brightness is low and hence have to use in very low lighting conditions.

While it worked well for halloween projection, the picture at best is somewhat fuzzy, no matter how close or distant, I could not get a good clear an crisp picture.  it is also somewhat distorted - not a square picture, either narrower at the bottom and top is fuzzy or narrow at top and fuzzy at the bottom.  There is no way the is 1080p, at best 720?  I tried playing a movie on the wall and again the very center of the picture id clear and goes fuzzy as you look around the edges at least 5" - 12" around.  Maybe ok for children outings and Halloween but dont expect much for movie nights.  Not really recommended.

Like many of the comments here, the volume/sound does not work. I read through all the instructions/directions and even on Youtube I cannot get the sound to work. The projector is also not that bright, nor is the quality too good, but it's fine for the price. My biggest gripe is with the fact that the volume/sound does not work for any website/program.

reviewTitle: Good quality picture but the actual projector doesn’t have a good lifespan
reviewDescription: I purchased the projector in may. It is now January 3rd 2024 and there’s a black line that goes straight through the picture and it’s very noticeable when watching movies. I LOVED this product until I seen this. The picture was AWESOME ! The product is trash though. Im going to see if I can get it fixed or replaced by amazon but this sucks !

reviewTitle: You have to have a pitch black room
reviewDescription: If you have a very dark room, works great. If you have any sort of light coming in. You will have a hard time seeing it. Speaker isn’t very loud and sounds a bit cheesy if that makes sense.  Ports like hdmi and usb are very close together so if you use a fire stick you can not plug anything else in. It’s ok over all

reviewTitle: Native resolution is 480-720p, not 1080p. difference is noticeable from afar
reviewDescription: The image resolution is very noticeably low: it is 480-720p as opposed to the stated 1080p. Text is readable, but it is blocky and strains the eyes. Other than the low resolution, the image quality is low as well. the grid structure from the pixel array is visible and noticeable from afar. The individual rgb colors are noticeably separate as well. Some reviews say that the low image quality is only noticeable if you go directly up to the screen, but this is incorrect: it is very much noticeable from a normal viewing distance. These statements are true even for the native menu. The combined effect is that it becomes difficult to look at the screen after some minutes.Occasionally it also makes a harsh static-like noise when it tries to play sound.The price is very low for a projector, sure. But the lack in quality makes it almost unusable. Would not recommend.

This is okay at best. The picture is not that clear, nor does it get very bright. This is half way between a toy and a mediocre projector. Do not expect much. I guess good for the kids, but don't think this will impress on movie night. Kind of a pain to get connected and working. I can't watch Netflix with it either

This projector is compact, but that is where the niceties end.  Right off the bat it does not have a lens cover.  At first I thought perhaps mine was not included in the package, but after checking the contents list it does not exist.  There is however a laundry list of accessories listed for sale to enhance this unit.  It is not very bright and requires a totally dark room it be viewed.  A better buy would be the BEXTZUBY unit sold on Amazon.  Its less expensive and comes with everything including a carry case.  It is however a bit larger than the this unit, but better in every way.

This is my first projector. I was tired of paying insane amounts of money for big flatscreens. I am blown away with how crisp the image quality is. I have a MacBook Pro so I purchased a USBC to HDMI adapter separately and it worked like a charm. The focus dial is great. I have my MacBook hooked up to bluetooth speakers so I can’t speak on the built-in sound. Great lil projector. You won’t find a better one for the price.

!! Read after “Overall” to get the concise review !!This projector is beyond my expectations. I originally watched a video review displaying a childrens’  movie, I believe it was the cartoon version of the grinch. Either way I didn’t waste time purchasing after realizing the picture quality was amazing, the projector was affordable, with a 4.5 star rating.The inspiration review states the quality depends on how much lighting is in the room or outside, which is true. I like to suggest purchasing a projector screen (or becoming a VIP customer after purchasing the projector and receive a free one. All it takes is an email). Because, as you can see in my video, the quality was great but the texture and color of my wall didn’t allow certain parts of the movie to show up well. * If your wall is white this wouldn’t be so much of a problem.* I projected on my white shower curtain and the quality was unmatched!Also, I read some of the low rated reviews while waiting for my projector. After receiving mine I made sure to look out for any similar issues. Which I did, but we’re easily fixed using the simple instructions and my handie dandy thinking cap. Such as: the sound not working for Netflix or Amazon prime. It clearly states in the instruction it will not play since these are copy-righted streaming platforms. This is easily fixed by opting out to plugging in your fire stick or utilizing Bluetooth speakers connected to what ever device your using. Use the fire stick if you are utilizing the built in speakers, use the blue tooth speakers as an alternative (especially if you don’t have a fire stick and don’t plan on purchasing one in the near future).Overall,The pros are:-Affordable quality image projection with minimal adjusting needed (and possibly a projector screen).-Qaulity built in dual speakers-They offer 12 month warranty-They offer a 3 month guarantee to your money back-You get a free gift(s) after following the steps to becoming an AuKing VIP customer by simply emailing their customer service team.Cons:- Batteries are not included for the remote-You’ll need to purchase an HDMI adapter to connect your phone, even though their is an USB port. It doesn’t work to connect phones.
Easy to set up, the instructions tell you everything you need to know, and it projects so clear even without a backdrop!!

I spent like 60 on this while it was on sale and I would buy it again. I’ve added a picture of it on during the brightest part of the day in my room, as you can see not so clear/ lumens seem inaccurate. However at night/ in the dark this thing is awesome. I choose to hook up speakers to mine, you don’t have to. I use a fire stick as well and it was pretty easy to set up. The fan is a little loud if you’re right by it but this this is worth it. Mines also just on a cheap camera tripod I’ve had lying around. The projector is super light so it works fine
Was hesitant on buying a compact projector. Glad I did this one is amazing! Highly recommend this projector if you are in the market for a compact device!!

reviewTitle: Can't beat it for the price. Plug n play
reviewDescription: A little hesitant because let's face it how good is a $100 projector. I have this in my outdoor "smoke lounge" we don't smoke in the house. Previously we had a $200 vankyo 530w. It lasted longer than anyone said it would using it everyday almost all day most days.I got this projector from Amazon 42% off and used my gift card I got in Christmas. Technically I only spent $11 on this so even if it's trash in 6 months it'll have paid for itself. I'm quite surprised at the picture especially the brightness. So far it's beyond my expectations.I realize there's a lot of projector guys out there that swear you won't get a decent one less then $500. Even still at 42% for $57 I could buy 10 of these she last longer than summer of those you pay thousands for, I'mjust saying.

reviewTitle: It is working like a Champ.
reviewDescription: It's money well spent, and I'm watching the Olympic games on my projector now.

Purchased as a Christmas gift in December 2023 for my 9 year old. We have spent hours upon hours using this projector and it’s still going strong. We do out door movies but for the most part, it sits on top of my headboard as my own personal home theater. For sound, I use a blue tooth small speaker but you do need an auxiliary cord. The sound in the projector is good, but the speaker makes it so much better. I don’t even use a screen, I project onto my bedroom room and it’s incredibly clear. I would recommend this projector to any and everyone.

Oh my god it was my first time buying a projector I didn’t know how to use it but this was very easy especially with the discount I decided to buy it and it works amazing the images look so much better than on a phone and very clear definitely should get it if your thinking about it!

Comparing to my old Optoma HD65 from 2008, I'm only looking at Image quality not other features.Image is not crisp & safe to say is blurry at any distance.Don't know what lumen rating is but it definitely less than 1600, hence the picture is not bright.Most annoying, image displayed is trapezoid shape with supposed keystone feature unable to correct.The 80% fan noise reduction is a complete lie. Its noisy as heck.

We bought another one of these for the same price point and it was way brighter and didnt wash out with the windows open.  Dissapointing waste of 60 dollars for an average picture with washed out lighting at the same cost.
Malísima experiencia. Vivo en el extranjero. Devolver este artículo me saldrá costoso. Me siento timada.

I was looking for different projector options ( cost effective) for my basement home theatre where I am projecting on my wall. My wall is specially painted for sharper projection and brightness. But the main problem is brightness. With this cheap projectors it’s difficult to reach the required lumen. Then I found this $50 projector promising 9800 lumen. Bought it and in 10 minutes returning it. Its absolutely wrong. The brightness is so poor that I could not stand this crap for 5 minutes. Picture quality ? Laughable . I am shocked to see this cheap thing is #1 in projector. Such a waste of time.

reviewTitle: Does not work - ask you to download bogus app
reviewDescription: The first time I bought this product it worked fine. I lost it and replaced it, this time the projectors displays a scan that leads you to an app in the App Store. I was suspicious but downloaded it, the app doesn’t work or connect or even recognize an HDMI connection. It does not work.

Shortly after our product support window closed, a dark orange spot started to appear, and it has now taken up half of the viewing area amd is turning brown. There is obviously a burn somewhere inside, but I can't gmfigure it out. Pretty disappointing, even though it was purchased as a semi-temporary solution.

reviewTitle: Will not Load JPEG, JPG, BMP or PNG files from USB Drive
reviewDescription: Was excited about this product since it apparently received 4.5 stars. Received product, followed instructions for setup, loaded files onto USB drive, software responded that image files were not supported. Researched the questions and reviews; company responded about the USB drive NTFS and FAT formatting requirements, blah, blah, blah...... Formatted 3 different USB drives with 3 different formatting conventions, still the same outcome that files were of an incompatible format. Spent about 3 hours and multiple scenarios trying to get the files to load on the projector, nothing! Wrapped it back up and returned it to Amazon for a refund. Appears many buyers had the same issue, I just didn't realize it was an issue prior to the purchase. Software was clunky and archaic, visually it appeared to be written 25 years ago during the DOS era. Really was disappointed with this purchase.

reviewTitle: Plugged in HDMI and shorted out
reviewDescription: This was a good product for price but shorted out in 2 months.  Not as bright as other projectors in this price range.
Not clear image

First off, I never knew the projector does not come ready to pair with your phone. You need to spend at least another $15 on the HDMI adapter. (Would’ve at least been nice to know that before buying it.) After I finally set up the projector, everything worked well and the picture and sound were really clear. I loved it. So then I tried to put on a movie through Netflix. It wouldn’t load through the projector. Although disappointing, I wasn’t too surprised since Netflix won’t even let you take screenshots. But then today, I tried to play a movie on Amazon. It would play through my phone but wouldn’t load on the projector. My sister looked up information and apparently you can’t use any of these streaming sites unless you have a Firestick or some other remote?? What is the point of a projector if it won’t allow you to watch a movie? I’ve already

reviewTitle: Good for the price but blurry edges
reviewDescription: It's pretty decent for the price but edges focus is not even. When focus is adjusted for clearer picture, the edges are much more blurry compared to the center.Looks like software could be fixed/updated ...

reviewTitle: If it worked, it would probably be really nice for this price.
reviewDescription: The picture is what you would expect from this price point. When I could get it to work, it looked ok out in the dark backyard for movie night. What I didn’t like was not being able to actually watch anything. It is advertised ad plug and play. I have the correct adaptor for my iPhone Xr which works on anything I plug it into. I tried the HDMI cable sent with the device and a better Monster brand 4k 60FPS cable...nope, my kids were let down. Netflix...fail, Disney Plus...fail...Apple+... fail. My home movies worked 50% of the time and my Plex video tests were 75% win. I have not tried a computer connected to this device, but I got it for the small size and expecting it to work with my iPhone in the backyard...no dice. If something can’t be configured to make this work I’ll disappointedly be requesting a refund for basically an over priced lightbulb.Update Nov 2020 --I've now used the projector a few times and wanted to provide some useful feedback on real world use, not just testing it. The device does lack the latest HDMI standards so don't expect to play any streaming services. I've tried an iPad, iPhone, Laptop and Apple TV 4K. I thought it was working with the Apple TV because trailers would play audio and picture, but when I went to watch a movie...it was 1890 with silent films.HOWEVER, I am still going to test it with an older Apple TV 3rd Gen to see if maybe it will work as it also doesn't have the latest HDMI codecs. For halloween I put out a sheet on the driveway and played "It's the Greatest Pumpkin Charlie Brown" for kids walking the neighbor hood and adults to hand out. The picture worked very well at max size (120" or so diagonally) with sound being only slightly off sync with the sound bar connected to the audio out jack. The video was played via my local Plex server using an iPhone on an HDMI adaptor and a Monster HDMI cable. I did have to wait for the sun to set completely to see the picture and start focusing and such. I forgot to take a picture of the set up.This works well for backyard movie nights, driveway neighbor hangouts but don't expect too much as the viewing options are limited. The best results so far would be a local video system. I've not tried a Blueray player connected yet. Lastly, using an iPad with the sound connected directly (no audio though the projector) provided a much better sync experience on a previous backyard movie night.

EDIT: Turns out you have to use a FAT32 disc partition, not the new NTFS or else the supported file types will not play, at least off USB/MicroSD. The files still played via HDMI->Phone. Overall it's a decent projector especially for the price. Great for small projects or backyard movie (given it's semi-dark).So this is one of those mass-produced, cheap projectors. Seems to have decent picture even during bright-ish daylight. My gripe here though is I wanted to load some media onto the supported USB or preferably MicroSD card and play it. I have tried at least a dozen different media formats using no less than 3 different source files and every single one results in the "Unsupported Media Format" error and refuses to so much as attempt to play anything. Now I have to do something like try to play my media from my phone, which means an adapter, extra chargers, or something else, which isn't ideal. I wanted a mini projector for some video decorations for halloween, but requiring the extra chargers, cables, etc to work is a huge pain.

reviewTitle: UNA OPCION BUENA PARA EL COSTO
reviewDescription: El producto es bueno

Really good picture for the price great value having a try to work out a few bugs with the sound only on Netflix I can get the sound to work, but have to keep turning it off and on to restart it all my other apps I cannot get the sound to work Amazon prime can’t seem to get sound

I purchased this projector with high hopes, but I must say, the reviews don’t add up. The brightness is awful, and the picture was way too dark to be enjoyable to watch. Even adjusting the Brightness setting did nothing to help.Furthermore, there are focus issues that persisted, despite setting up the projector/screen distance and height correctly. The overall quality had a frustrating blur to it that made the viewing experience far from satisfying.To top it off, my sound seemed off as well. This is definitely not an item you can use to upgrade your movie nights.However, I should note that this projector might have a niche use. If you have a child's room and are dealing with a situation where a TV on a stand is constantly knocked over, as I do with my autistic nephew, this projector might come in handy. It's not suitable for high-quality viewing, but it can serve as an alternative in specific situations. So, while I'm disappointed with its overall performance, it does have its niche use.

reviewTitle: Great picture quality, but hopeful for the replacements audio
reviewDescription: The picture quality is nice, simple to use. Easy set up. I'm mostly going to be using it to trace my digital art onto big canvases. However, the sound was terrible. When I hook it up to my laptop and have the audio play from the projector, it skips very badly and the video begins freezing as well. I requested a replacement and am hopeful this first projector was just a faulty one. Will update my review when I receive the new one soon!EDIT/UPDATE: Unfortunately the replacement projector also skips sound when connected to my Macbook. I've tried the Battony USB C to HDMI Adapter Adapter Multiport, the uni USB C to HDMI Cable, and I was even sent a recommended hdmi to usb-c cable by the company and no luck. Again, the video quality still displays but I'll have to play sound from my laptop only. I have a Macbook Air M1 2020. Don't know if it's just my laptop.
La calidad no es tan buena pero funciona bien.

reviewTitle: If you have a MacBook Read This
reviewDescription: I purchased the M8-F, if i would have read the reviews first i probably would not have purchased.To begin I was so excited to use this projector with my Macbook Air, because I chose not to have a tv in my room. I already had plenty of HDMI and HDMI Macbook adapters on hand so I thought the setup would be easy. After switching out serval cords i got the same message "HDMI no signal". I did some research to find out these things are not compatible with macbooks no matter what kind of direct adapter that you use.I gave this thing one final attempt before i made the decision to send it back. I found my Chromecast stick. I plugged it in and got a HDMI signal. I was able to stream through it with my laptop by using the Chrome browser. I am happy i thought of this otherwise I would have been pretty upset. I still kind of am though. It would be nice for them to mention this is not directly compatible with macbooks. A firestick will work too.
Came with no cords no remote not very happy piad for itandcant even use it

reviewTitle: Don’t buy it if you want something that last long
reviewDescription: I am totally disappointed. I bought this projector in November 2022 and in few months it broke. I was in the climax of an anime episode and the projector shut it down. I tried turning it on, changing the plugs but nothing worked. Needless to say: I barely used and when I tried to, it broke. What a waste of money ):

reviewTitle: Definitely get what you pay for
reviewDescription: Just set this bad boy up for our first outdoor movie night on the deck. Sadly came to find out the speakers are terrible and actually blew out during the first successful movie viewing. Also should note for some reason the sound does not play in Netflix, to be specific, you get sound on previews but when actually playing a selection the sound magically disappears. We spent an hour fiddling with the sound settings and tried other sources (sound bar, beatbox, computer speakers). Luckily we had an audio - audio cable and the sound bar finally played the movie. I feel this ordeal may be avoided having a Bluetooth feature perhaps. Either way it was not worth the purchase and I will be returning.

details do not indicate if it is compliant with HDCP. in 2 months, there will be zero content that can be streamed thru this projector.either put it in the descrpition, or take it down and stop misleading people.

I was excited about the HDMI connection and when that didn’t work, I figured hey, the USB connection should be just fine… I wasn’t. It won’t read windows 11 or Mac OS. The only thing the projector reads is a portable USB stick.Realistically I didn’t expect much from an $80 dollar projector but at most I hoped it would connect to a PC and, I don’t know project video or games. I didn’t expected a brick sized USB reader. I’m disappointed and frustrated.

So I brought this a while ago and just opened it to use it! I can Hear the movie but I can not see the picture. I’m highly disappointed because I can no longer return it. I even  Went out and brought the attachments needed for linking through a phone and still does not work.
Doesn’t conect to anything!  No signal, no nothing!

Im pretty tech savvy, I couldn’t get this to work. I plugged in a fire stick, an Xbox with an hdmi cable, a switch with an hdmi cable, it simply never projected anything. I see a solid red light and the power button won’t do anything.I emailed the customer support on the use Manuel and got no answer. Amazon customer support was less helpful.I’ll give it another try in case mine was defective. If I get it working I’ll update.
This would be a bad item to buy the item didn’t work even 3 weeks after the first use
I bought this because the description states it can be used with a laptop. Well a MacBook is a laptop and it won’t work. Then I tried it with my older HP laptop. Same thing, won’t work.

It is listed as having "wireless" along with HDMI but there is no mention of anything wireless on the device or in the manual except the remote - no bluetooth and no wifi.  WIthout a special adapter, it can't do a smartphone either. Very misleading.

reviewTitle: Buy different speakers to go with it.
reviewDescription: Is good for price but unfortunately mine came with a scratch o. The lense and the speaker blew within the first day and the volume wasnt even all the way up.

I bought this and it worked great for the first hour then the screen started shaking and I was unable to fix it. Couldn't get a refund because it was too long after I bought it. wouldn't buy again. 2/10.
went out after a year says a 2 year warranty but no information to contact support.
This projector doesn’t always play the audio for movies on different apps like Netflix, Hulu, Amazon and AT&T Now.  This has not been a good purchase for me.
It’s not worth it guys lol. I’m returning it
Its so dim it cant be enjoyed. Figures for 70 bucks.Its junk!
Not bad for the price. The only thing i hate is that my image is projecting crooked and seems there’s no way to fix it.

reviewTitle: It might be good for low resolution videos but not for text
reviewDescription: My plan was to use it for a basic meeting projector but I was not able to have the text in focus across the entire screen at once. Either the center was in focus or the outside.
It is compact projector. But not very much clear, always blurry either on topside or bottom. With Keystone setting also it didn’t make it better. I may have to return it back.
Box was missing the remote and missing the HDMI cable. Not the end of the world but I didn’t have time to return it. Able to purchase a cable to connect, easy to use, and great picture.
Haven't set up yet. Will come back and update but looks great out of box!

reviewTitle: Good little projector, but key feature does not work as it should.
reviewDescription: Overall it’s a good value. I had planned to use these (have purchased multiple) for my outdoor holiday projections.  They work well for this use - bright enough at night to shoot large images on the garage door and house.  BUT - the key feature for me in this use case is the auto on and off timer. The timer does turn the projector on like it should, however it ignores the input setting - so the projector comes on and just displays the menu. You have to manually select HDMI each time It turns on. This is totally unworkable for me and I’ll likely have to return them.

reviewTitle: It’s ok but the volume is very low
reviewDescription: I’m not sure how to improve volume. We can hardly hear it. On my device volume is all way up but playing on the projector volume goes just down. Probably I need to add speaker

reviewTitle: It doesn't project very far. We couldn't even use it to shine on a wall 8 feet away.
reviewDescription: We liked that we could play sound along with the show. But we were very disappointed that people couldn't see what we were trying to show! The light bulb looked good. We couldn't figure out what the issue was and have stored it away unused for 2 years now.

This company is by far one of the best, my first out-of-the-box experience was not the best. The team worked with me to make sure I was able to set everything up and this has to be one of the most cost-effective projectors out there. Super clear display.

Box arrived opened and ripped (inside Amazon box) It worked well the two times I used it so I wasn’t worried. Then glass lens fell out and broke.
