Such a waste of time. Doesn’t explain how to connect to the projector and doesn’t even give me batteries for the remote it gave me. The directions didn’t even help me. I wish I could give it 0 stars it did not help me at all. I’m so sad

This is a good projector but after a few months I started to see the black spots to clean the unit. I purchased a cleaning kit but it was too small to clean it so I bought another projector and kept the cleaning kit it came with. Now it’s been mths later and I see the dust spots but the projector is difficult to clean. I am unable to clean the dust spots from the lens. So I am dissatisfied with this projector.

reviewTitle: Can’t even use it with any streaming!
reviewDescription: Update: I’m still giving this 1 star. I read the reviews after my initial delivery and saw that people got sent to them full blown new projectors with Bluetooth capabilities and when the company messaged me after they saw my review and said “we will send you a firestick”. I waited almost 20 days just for them to send me this android stick… I don’t even use android products so this is just annoying at this point. Do not buy. Simple as that! They try to fix a gunshot wound with a bandaid… no thank you! This will not work with streaming devices and I am not happy about using an android  tv stick when I thought I was going to get an Amazon fire stick… so annoying!Don’t bother. Can’t watch any of my streaming services, just YouTube! And I don’t want to have to buy other plugs to make it work. Ruined our movie night we had planned smh

It was late then I open the box there’s only the projector and the manual to tell me to use the remote and power cord lol guess those were forgotten in the  boxing up process pretty upset can’t speak to anything about it but having to return it
It came broken. The charging port doesn't hold the charging cord. It's very loose. The volume is horrible. You have to sit right next to it to hear it.
Can’t see it in a dark room during the day, have to buy extra stuff to get it to use with a smart phone

I purchased this projector at the beginning of October, and it started glitching by the end of November. The return window closed November 7th, but I had 90 days of support online via Amazon chat. During the chat, the rep offered a return for a refund. I had to order the replacement separately. Little did I know, they were charging a restocking fee. This was never discussed in my chat, and considering the item is defective, it shouldn't be restocked.  So my 90 days of support ended up being a bust, and I spent additional money for a shoddy product. There's a reason this projector is so inexpensive. Spend the money on a better unit, don't buy this one. In fact, don't buy from this seller.

Had this budget friendly device set up last night for some Halloween decor and at first it looked pretty good overall. Shut it down after maybe a 2 hr run period and the next night I have a line across the top of the screen as shown in the photos. They are sending out a replacement unit, so we will see how we do the second time around… stay tunedSo second time around the projector lasted 3 evenings before having the same issue the first one had after 3 nights…… I can understand that given the low price I had proper expectations that the image quality wouldn’t be amazing but overall for the price the image was pretty decent for the price…. However buyer beware of the longevity of this product cause this is the second unit that has failed, the first one after 2 hours of run time and the second lasted about 6 hours of total run time over 3 nights.Complete waste of money based off 2 different units having the same issue. Won’t be asking for an exchange but just a refund unfortunately.
Unable to use with my Mac. Returned.

reviewTitle: NOT a 1080P resolution as they claimed...
reviewDescription: I believe this was false advertisement... I ordered this one and my step mom ordered a different one for my dad on fathers day. We decided to test them both out to see which one we should return and I thought to myself that I got him the better one because this product that claims to be 1080P, but yet it has worse quality photo then the one my stepmom got him that claims to be a 780P... It's either this product over estimated it's quality or the other product underestimated there's. Either way, the one that claims to be 780P can display a partially bigger screen and get a way better pictures resolution/quality then this one that's supposedly 1080P... Very disappointed if I was really deceived into thinking that I was buying a well quality-built projector when in reality it's not... I've messed with it a lot trying to see if there was a setting I've missed, I found the optimal angle so that both the top and bottom of the picture were clean but it still showed a poor quality picture compared to the clearer 780P bigger size display. I'm fairly upset because there were many reviews on this product and it was just about at 5 stars rating, makes me think how many people thought they got a really good projector when in reality they were tricked and deceived just like I was...
